text: [{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What is a delegate in Concur?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What is a delegate in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "In Concur, a delegate is a user who is granted permission to perform tasks on behalf of another user. These tasks can include creating, submitting, and approving expense reports. To act as a delegate, you must have the same level or higher permissions, and the other user must assign you as their delegate. You can act as a delegate by selecting 'Profile', then 'Act as Another User', and choosing the user from the list. You must confirm email addresses to send receipts on behalf of the user. When acting as a delegate, you can manage tasks within the rights granted by the user. To stop acting as a delegate, you can switch back to 'Myself' under 'Act as Another User'."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What is a delegate in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "In Concur, a delegate is a user who is granted permission to perform tasks on behalf of another user. These tasks can include creating, submitting, and approving expense reports. To act as a delegate, you must have the same level or higher permissions, and the other user must assign you as their delegate. You can act as a delegate by selecting 'Profile', then 'Act as Another User', and choosing the user from the list. You must confirm email addresses to send receipts on behalf of the user. When acting as a delegate, you can manage tasks within the rights granted by the user. To stop acting as a delegate, you can switch back to 'Myself' under 'Act as Another User'."}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I verify email addresses for sending receipts as a delegate?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What is a delegate in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "In Concur, a delegate is a user who is granted permission to perform tasks on behalf of another user. These tasks can include creating, submitting, and approving expense reports. To act as a delegate, you must have the same level or higher permissions, and the other user must assign you as their delegate. You can act as a delegate by selecting 'Profile', then 'Act as Another User', and choosing the user from the list. You must confirm email addresses to send receipts on behalf of the user. When acting as a delegate, you can manage tasks within the rights granted by the user. To stop acting as a delegate, you can switch back to 'Myself' under 'Act as Another User'."}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I verify email addresses for sending receipts as a delegate?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To verify email addresses for sending receipts as a delegate in Concur, you must first act as a delegate for the user who has granted you this permission. Follow these steps: Select 'Profile', then 'Act as Another User', enter the appropriate user's name, and select 'Switch'. Now, while acting as the user, go to 'Profile Settings' and select 'Email Addresses'. Ensure that both your email address and the user's email address are verified. Once both addresses are verified, you can send receipt images by emailing them to receipts@concur.com if reporting from a laptop or mobile device, or to receipts@expenseit.com if using the ExpenseIt add-on product. When sending receipts, include only the user's email address in the subject line and attach the appropriate receipts. The images will then be viewable in the 'Available Receipts' section of the 'Manage Expenses' screen. To stop acting as a delegate, select 'Acting as <user name>', choose 'Act as Another User', select 'Myself', and then click 'Switch' to return to your own profile."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What tasks can a delegate perform on behalf of another user in Concur?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What tasks can a delegate perform on behalf of another user in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'A delegate in Concur can perform several tasks on behalf of another user. These tasks include creating, submitting, and approving expense reports. Additionally, a delegate can email receipts on behalf of the user they are working for, provided they have verified their own email address (and possibly the user’s email address). The delegate needs the same level or higher permissions and must be assigned as a delegate by the user. When acting as a delegate, they can send receipt images to specific email addresses depending on the products used, such as receipts@concur.com or receipts@expenseit.com. They must enter the user’s email address in the subject line and attach the appropriate receipts for the images to be ready for reporting. To switch back to working for themselves, the delegate can select the option to act as themselves in the system.'}]

To switch back to working for themselves, the delegate can select the option to act as themselves in the system.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I verify my email address and the email address of the user I am acting on behalf of in Concur?'}]

They must enter the user’s email address in the subject line and attach the appropriate receipts for the images to be ready for reporting. To switch back to working for themselves, the delegate can select the option to act as themselves in the system.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I verify my email address and the email address of the user I am acting on behalf of in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To verify your email address and the email address of the user you are acting on behalf of in Concur, follow these steps: 

1. Make sure you are acting as a delegate. 
2. Select 'Acting as <user name>', then select 'Profile Settings'. 
3. Select 'Email Addresses'. 
4. Follow the prompts to verify your own email address. 
5. If necessary, originate the verification of the user's email address. 

Once both email addresses are verified, you can email receipt images for reporting to receipts@concur.com or, if using the ExpenseIt add-on product, to receipts@expenseit.com. When sending receipts on behalf of another user, enter the user’s email address in the subject line of the email and attach the appropriate receipts."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How can a user assign a delegate in Concur?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How can a user assign a delegate in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To assign a delegate in Concur, a user must follow the steps below:

1. Select 'Profile' on the Concur dashboard.
2. Choose 'Act as Another User'. Ensure the option 'A Delegate for another user who has granted you this permission' is selected.
3. Enter the name or part of the name of the user for whom you want to act as a delegate.
4. Select the appropriate user from the list and then select 'Switch'.

By following these steps, the specified user will be acting as a delegate and will have the rights and privileges as determined by the delegator, such as creating, submitting, or approving expense reports on their behalf."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How can a user assign a delegate in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To assign a delegate in Concur, a user must follow the steps below:

1. Select 'Profile' on the Concur dashboard.
2. Choose 'Act as Another User'. Ensure the option 'A Delegate for another user who has granted you this permission' is selected.
3. Enter the name or part of the name of the user for whom you want to act as a delegate.
4. Select the appropriate user from the list and then select 'Switch'.

By following these steps, the specified user will be acting as a delegate and will have the rights and privileges as determined by the delegator, such as creating, submitting, or approving expense reports on their behalf."}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'What steps should I follow to email receipts on behalf of the user I am acting as a delegate for in Concur?'}]
[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What permissions are needed to act as a delegate for another user?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What permissions are needed to act as a delegate for another user?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To act as a delegate for another user, you need to have the same level or higher permissions as the user you are acting on behalf of. Additionally, the user must assign you as a delegate.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What permissions are needed to act as a delegate for another user?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To act as a delegate for another user, you need to have the same level or higher permissions as the user you are acting on behalf of. Additionally, the user must assign you as a delegate.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "How do I verify my email address and the user's email address to send receipts on their behalf?"}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What permissions are needed to act as a delegate for another user?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To act as a delegate for another user, you need to have the same level or higher permissions as the user you are acting on behalf of. Additionally, the user must assign you as a delegate.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "How do I verify my email address and the user's email address to send receipts on their behalf?"}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To verify your email address and the user's email address in order to send receipts on their behalf, follow these steps: 

1. Verify your own email address: 
 	- Go to your Profile Settings.
 	- Select 'Email Addresses' and verify your email address.

2. Verify the user's email address: 
 	- While acting as the user, go to their Profile Settings.
 	- Select 'Email Addresses' and verify their email address.

Once both email addresses are verified, you can send receipt images for reporting: 

1. Compose an email to receipts@concur.com (or receipts@expenseit.com if you have the ExpenseIt add-on).
2. In the Subject line, enter only the user's email address.
3. Attach the appropriate receipt(s).

After sending the email, the receipts will be visible in the Available Receipts section of the Manage Expenses screen for the user."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What permissions are needed to act as a delegate for another user?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To act as a delegate for another user, you need to have the same level or higher permissions as the user you are acting on behalf of. Additionally, the user must assign you as a delegate.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "How do I verify my email address and the user's email address to send receipts on their behalf?"}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To verify your email address and the user's email address in order to send receipts on their behalf, follow these steps: 

1. Verify your own email address: 
 	- Go to your Profile Settings.
 	- Select 'Email Addresses' and verify your email address.

2. Verify the user's email address: 
 	- While acting as the user, go to their Profile Settings.
 	- Select 'Email Addresses' and verify their email address.

Once both email addresses are verified, you can send receipt images for reporting: 

1. Compose an email to receipts@concur.com (or receipts@expenseit.com if you have the ExpenseIt add-on).
2. In the Subject line, enter only the user's email address.
3. Attach the appropriate receipt(s).

After sending the email, the receipts will be visible in the Available Receipts section of the Manage Expenses screen for the user."}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'Can you guide me through the process of switching back to my own profile after acting as a delegate for another user?'}]
[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'Can a delegate with lower permissions act on behalf of a user with higher permissions?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'Can a delegate with lower permissions act on behalf of a user with higher permissions?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'No, a delegate with lower permissions cannot act on behalf of a user with higher permissions. A delegate can only act on behalf of someone if they have the same level or higher permissions and have been assigned as a delegate by that user.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'Can a delegate with lower permissions act on behalf of a user with higher permissions?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'No, a delegate with lower permissions cannot act on behalf of a user with higher permissions. A delegate can only act on behalf of someone if they have the same level or higher permissions and have been assigned as a delegate by that user.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I assign someone as a delegate in Concur?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'Can a delegate with lower permissions act on behalf of a user with higher permissions?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'No, a delegate with lower permissions cannot act on behalf of a user with higher permissions. A delegate can only act on behalf of someone if they have the same level or higher permissions and have been assigned as a delegate by that user.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I assign someone as a delegate in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To assign someone as a delegate in Concur, follow these steps:

1. Select 'Profile'.
2. Select 'Act as Another User'. Ensure the 'A Delegate for another user who has granted you this permission' option is selected.
3. Enter all or part of the appropriate user's name.
4. Select the user from the list.
5. Select 'Switch'. You are now acting as a delegate for this user.

To verify email addresses for sending receipts on behalf of another user:
1. Select 'Acting as <user name>', then select 'Profile Settings'.
2. Select 'Email Addresses'.
3. Verify both your email address and the user's email address.
4. Send receipt images to receipts@concur.com or receipts@expenseit.com (if you have the ExpenseIt add-on).

To return to working for yourself:
1. Select 'Acting as <user name>' again.
2. Select 'Act as Another User' and verify the 'Myself' option is selected.
3. Select 'Switch'."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I act as a delegate for another user?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I act as a delegate for another user?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To act as a delegate for another user, you need the same or higher level permissions and must be assigned as a delegate by that user. Here are the steps:
1. Go to 'Profile' and select 'Act as Another User.' Confirm that the 'A Delegate for another user who has granted you this permission' option is selected.
2. Enter part or all of the appropriate user’s name.
3. Select the user from the list and click 'Switch.' You are now acting as a delegate for this user, with rights and privileges as determined by them.
4. To email receipts on behalf of the user, verify your own and possibly the user's email addresses under 'Profile Settings' > 'Email Addresses.' Once verified, you can email receipt images to receipts@concur.com or receipts@expenseit.com if you have the ExpenseIt add-on.
5. When sending receipts on behalf of another user, enter only their email address in the subject line and attach the receipt(s). The images will be available for reporting in the 'Manage Expenses' screen under 'Available Receipts.'
6. To stop acting as a delegate and return to your own profile, select 'Acting as <user name>,' then 'Act as Another User,' and choose the 'Myself' option. Click 'Switch.'"}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I act as a delegate for another user?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To act as a delegate for another user, you need the same or higher level permissions and must be assigned as a delegate by that user. Here are the steps:
1. Go to 'Profile' and select 'Act as Another User.' Confirm that the 'A Delegate for another user who has granted you this permission' option is selected.
2. Enter part or all of the appropriate user’s name.
3. Select the user from the list and click 'Switch.' You are now acting as a delegate for this user, with rights and privileges as determined by them.
4. To email receipts on behalf of the user, verify your own and possibly the user's email addresses under 'Profile Settings' > 'Email Addresses.' Once verified, you can email receipt images to receipts@concur.com or receipts@expenseit.com if you have the ExpenseIt add-on.
5. When sending receipts on behalf of another user, enter only their email address in the subject line and attach the receipt(s). The images will be available for reporting in the 'Manage Expenses' screen under 'Available Receipts.'
6. To stop acting as a delegate and return to your own profile, select 'Acting as <user name>,' then 'Act as Another User,' and choose the 'Myself' option. Click 'Switch.'"}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "How do I verify the email address for myself or the user I'm acting on behalf of?"}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I act as a delegate for another user?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To act as a delegate for another user, you need the same or higher level permissions and must be assigned as a delegate by that user. Here are the steps:
1. Go to 'Profile' and select 'Act as Another User.' Confirm that the 'A Delegate for another user who has granted you this permission' option is selected.
2. Enter part or all of the appropriate user’s name.
3. Select the user from the list and click 'Switch.' You are now acting as a delegate for this user, with rights and privileges as determined by them.

1. First, ensure you are acting as a delegate for the appropriate user by selecting 'Profile', then 'Act as Another User'. Confirm that the 'A Delegate for another user who has granted you this permission' option is selected. Enter the user’s name, select them from the list, and then select 'Switch'.

2. While acting as a delegate, go to 'Profile Settings' and select 'Email Addresses'.

3. Verify your own email address. You may also need to start the verification of the user's email address from the respective profiles.

4. After both email addresses are verified, you can send receipt images for reporting. To send receipts, email the images to receipts@concur.com or receipts@expenseit.com if you have the ExpenseIt add-on product. Ensure you enter only the user’s email address in the Subject line and attach the appropriate receipts.

5. The receipt images will then be available for use in reporting in the Manage Expenses screen under the Available Receipts section.

6. To stop acting as a delegate and return to working for yourself, select 'Acting as <user name>', then 'Act as Another User', and verify that the 'Myself' option is selected. Finally, select 'Switch'."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How can I send receipt images for reporting from a mobile device?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To send receipt images for reporting from a mobile device, follow these steps:

1. Ensure your email address and the user's email address you are acting on behalf of are verified in the respective profiles.

2. Email the receipts to receipts@concur.com or to receipts@expenseit.com if you have the ExpenseIt add-on product.

3. When sending receipts on behalf of another user, enter only their email address in the Subject line and attach the appropriate receipt(s).

After you email the receipts, they will be viewable and ready for use in reporting from the Manage Expenses screen in the Available Receipts section."}]

1. **Assigning a Delegate**:
   - Open your profile, select 'Act as Another User', and confirm you have the delegate permission from the user.
   - Enter part or all of the appropriate user's name.
   - Select the user from the list and click 'Switch'. You will now be acting as a delegate for that user.

2. **Verify Email Addresses**:
   - While acting as a delegate, navigate to 'Profile Settings'.
   - Select 'Email Addresses'. Ensure both your email address and the email address of the user you are acting on behalf of are verified.

After completing these steps, you can send receipt images from a mobile device or laptop to receipts@concur.com or receipts@expenseit.com (if using the ExpenseIt add-on). Enter only the user’s email address in the Subject line and attach the receipts. The images will become viewable in the 'Available Receipts' section for reporting.

To stop acting as a delegate, select 'Acting as <user name>', then 'Act as Another User', and choose 'Myself'. Click 'Switch' to return to your own profile."}]

If issues persist, contact your administrator or Concur support for further assistance."}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "What should I do if I'm not sure my email is verified for sending receipts on behalf of another user?"}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To verify your email for sending receipts on behalf of another user in Concur, follow these steps:

1. Ensure that your email address is verified within your own profile in Concur.
2. If it is necessary to verify the email address of the user you are acting for, navigate to their profile.
3. Select 'Profile Settings'.
4. Select 'Email Addresses'.
5. Confirm that both email addresses (yours and the user's) are verified.

Once both emails are verified, you can send receipt images to receipts@concur.com or receipts@expenseit.com if you have the ExpenseIt add-on product. To send receipts on behalf of another user, enter only their email address in the Subject line of the email, attach the appropriate receipt(s), and send it. The receipts will then be available for reporting in the 'Manage Expenses' screen under the 'Available Receipts' section."}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I assign someone as a delegate in Concur?'}]

1. Select 'Profile' after logging in.
2. Choose 'Act as Another User' and ensure the 'A Delegate for another user who has granted you this permission' option is selected.

1. After logging in, select 'Profile' from the menu.
2. Choose 'Profile Settings' from the dropdown.
3. In the 'Profile Settings' menu, find and select 'Expense Delegates' under the 'Expense Settings' section.
4. Click on 'Add' to start adding a new delegate.
5. Enter the name or email address of the user you wish to assign as a delegate and select them from the search results.
6. Assign the appropriate permissions to the delegate. This can include tasks such as creating, submitting, and approving expense reports on your behalf.
7. Save your changes by clicking 'Save'.

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I start the process to activate e-receipts?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To start the process to activate e-receipts in SAP Concur, follow these steps: 

1. Go to the Profile icon and select Profile Settings. 
2. On the Profile Options page, select E-Receipt Activation. 
3. On the E-Receipt Activation page, read through the basic information that describes e-receipts. 
4. Select the enable link. 
5. Read through the E-Receipt Activation agreement, and then select I Agree. 

Receipts will then be successfully enabled. If you want to disable the E-Receipt Activation setting, you can select the disable link.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I add a cash advance to an existing expense report?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I add a cash advance to an existing expense report?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To add a cash advance to an existing expense report, follow these steps: 
1. On the SAP Concur home page, go to the Open Reports section and select the report to which you want to add the cash advance. You can also access approved cash advances via Report Details > Manage Cash Advances. 
2. If there are approved available cash advances, a message will be displayed. Select 'View'. 
3. On the Cash Advances page, select 'Add'. 
4. In the Available Cash Advances window, select the appropriate approved advance(s) from the list by checking the box(es). 
5. Click 'Add To Report'. 
6. After the cash advance is added to the report, select 'Close'. 
Once the cash advance is assigned to the report, proceed to add your expenses. The system might be configured to either allow a cash advance balance or require cash advance returns depending on your system's settings."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I add a cash advance to an existing expense report?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To add a cash advance to an existing expense report, follow these steps: 
1. On the SAP Concur home page, go to the Open Reports section and select the report to which you want to add the cash advance. You can also access approved cash advances via Report Details > Manage Cash Advances. 
2. If there are approved available cash advances, a message will be displayed. Select 'View'. 
3. On the Cash Advances page, select 'Add'. 
4. In the Available Cash Advances window, select the appropriate approved advance(s) from the list by checking the box(es). 
5. Click 'Add To Report'. 
6. After the cash advance is added to the report, select 'Close'. 
Once the cash advance is assigned to the report, proceed to add your expenses. The system might be configured to either allow a cash advance balance or require cash advance returns depending on your system's settings."}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'What should I do if I add a cash advance by mistake and need to remove it?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How can I access approved cash advances?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How can I access approved cash advances?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To access approved cash advances, you need to follow these steps: 
1. On the SAP Concur home page, go to the Open Reports section and select the report you want to add the cash advance to. Alternatively, you can access approved cash advances from the Report Details > Manage Cash Advances menu. 
2. If there are approved available cash advances, a message will be displayed. Select 'View'. 
3. On the Cash Advances page, select 'Add'. 
4. In the Available Cash Advances window, select the appropriate approved advance(s) from the list by checking the boxes. 
5. Select 'Add To Report'. 
6. After the cash advance is added to the report, select 'Close'. 
Once the cash advance is assigned to the report, you can add your expenses. Depending on your system configuration, you may either maintain a cash advance balance or be required to return any unused amount."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How can I access approved cash advances?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To access approved cash advances, you need to follow these steps:

3. On the Cash Advances page, select 'Add'. 
4. In the Available Cash Advances window, select the appropriate approved advance(s) from the list by checking the boxes. 
5. Select 'Add To Report'.

When you submit your expense report for approval, the system will notify you if a cash advance return is required."}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I delete a cash advance from a report in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To delete a cash advance from a report in Concur, follow these steps:
1. On the SAP Concur home page, in the Open Reports section, select the report from which you wish to remove the cash advance.
2. Select the 'Cash Advance' section.
3. In the Cash Advances page, locate the cash advance you want to delete and check the box next to it.
4. Select 'Remove.'
5. An Alert window will appear. Select 'Delete' to confirm the permanent deletion of the cash advance.
6. After deleting the cash advance, select 'Close' on the Cash Advances screen."}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "Is there a way to edit a cash advance amount once it's been added to an expense report?"}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'When was the tutorial last updated?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'The tutorial was last updated on 04 July 2023.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'Could you explain how to manage cash advances in Concur, specifically in terms of adding and removing them from a report?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'When was the tutorial last updated?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'The tutorial was last updated on 04 July 2023.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'Could you explain how to manage cash advances in Concur, specifically in terms of adding and removing them from a report?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To manage cash advances in Concur, follow these steps to add or remove them from a report: ### Adding a Cash Advance: 1. On the SAP Concur home page, navigate to the 'Open Reports' section. 2. Select the report you want to add the cash advance to. You can also access approved cash advances from the 'Report Details' > 'Manage Cash Advances' menu. 3. If there are approved available cash advances, a message will be displayed. Select 'View'. 4. On the 'Cash Advances' page, select 'Add'. 5. From the 'Available Cash Advances' window, choose the appropriate approved advance(s) from the list by selecting the corresponding checkbox(es). 6. Select 'Add To Report'. 7. Once the cash advance is added, select 'Close'. 8. After assigning the cash advance to the report, add your expenses. Note that your system might allow a cash advance balance or require cash advance returns. A cash advance balance allows you to carry forward any unused portion to a future expense report. The balance is determined by the amount of cash or out-of-pocket expenses entered on the report. Upon submission of the expense report for approval, the system will notify you if a cash advance return is required. ### Removing a Cash Advance: 1. To remove a cash advance, select the 'Cash Advance'. 2. Check the appropriate box for the assigned cash advance you want to remove, then select 'Remove'. 3. In the Alert window, select 'Delete'. Note that the cash advance will be permanently deleted. 4. After deleting the cash advance, on the 'Cash Advances' screen, select 'Close'."}]

First, review the report to ensure all expenses are correct. Once you've reviewed the report, select 'Approve & Forward'. On the Approve & Forward page, search for and select an additional approver by entering their name in the 'User Added Approver' field. [{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I add a new out-of-pocket expense to an expense report?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To add a new out-of-pocket expense to an expense report, follow these steps: 

1. From the report page, select 'Add Expense'. 
2. Select the 'Create New Expense' tab. 
3. Select the appropriate expense type. 
4. On the 'New Expense' page, complete all the required fields and any additional information. Then, select 'Out of Pocket' from the 'Payment type' dropdown menu. 
5. To attach a receipt, select the 'Receipt Status' dropdown arrow, choose 'Receipt', and then select 'Add Receipt'. 
6. Select the appropriate receipt from your available receipts or choose 'Upload New Receipt'. 
7. Click 'Attach'. 
8. Click 'Save Expense'. 
Your new out-of-pocket expense will be added to your expense report."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I attach a receipt to an expense?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To attach a receipt to an expense, follow these steps: 

1. From the expense report page, select 'Add Expense'. 
2. Select the 'Create New Expense' tab. 
3. Choose the appropriate expense type. 
4. On the 'New Expense' page, fill in all required fields and choose 'Out of Pocket' from the Payment type dropdown menu. 
5. To attach a receipt, click the 'Receipt Status' dropdown arrow, select 'Receipt', and then click 'Add Receipt'. 
6. Choose an existing receipt from your available receipts or select 'Upload New Receipt'. 
7. Click 'Attach'. 
8. Finally, select 'Save Expense'. 

The receipt will now be attached to your out-of-pocket expense."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I allocate an expense in an expense report?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I allocate an expense in an expense report?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To allocate an expense in an expense report, follow these steps: 1. From the open report, select the checkbox for the expense you want to allocate, or select the checkbox at the top of the column to select all expenses. 2. Click on 'Allocate'. This will open the Allocate screen where you can choose to allocate your expenses by 'Percent' or 'Amount'. 3. To allocate by percent, ensure 'Percent' is selected, then click 'Add'. Enter the necessary information and click 'Save'. You can add additional line items by clicking 'Add'. 4. After selecting the appropriate department, click 'Save'. Adjust the Percent amount if needed, and the other line items will automatically adjust to equal 100 percent. 5. Click 'Save' to save the allocations and return to your expense report. 6. To view the allocation, click on the 'Allocated' link, which will display allocation details in a separate window. Modify or close the window as needed. For allocating by amount: 1. Select the expense to open it, then click 'Allocate'. 2. Select 'Amount' to assign allocations by amount. 3. Add line items by clicking 'Add' and choose the appropriate department, then click 'Save'. 4. Modify the amounts as needed, ensuring the total matches the expense amount. 5. Click 'Save'. 6. Finally, save the allocation for the expense by clicking 'Save Expense'. Your expenses are now allocated, and you can submit your report."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I allocate an expense in an expense report?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To allocate an expense in an expense report, follow these steps: 1. From the open report, select the checkbox for the expense you want to allocate, or select the checkbox at the top of the column to select all expenses. 2. Click on 'Allocate'. This will open the Allocate screen where you can choose to allocate your expenses by 'Percent' or 'Amount'. 3. To allocate by percent, ensure 'Percent' is selected, then click 'Add'. Enter the necessary information and click 'Save'. You can add additional line items by clicking 'Add'. 4. After selecting the appropriate department, click 'Save'. Adjust the Percent amount if needed, and the other line items will automatically adjust to equal 100 percent. 5. Click 'Save' to save the allocations and return to your expense report. 6. To view the allocation, click on the 'Allocated' link, which will display allocation details in a separate window. Modify or close the window as needed. For allocating by amount: 1. Select the expense to open it, then click 'Allocate'. 2. Select 'Amount' to assign allocations by amount. 3. Add line items by clicking 'Add' and choose the appropriate department, then click 'Save'. 4. Modify the amounts as needed, ensuring the total matches the expense amount. 5. Click 'Save'. 6. Finally, save the allocation for the expense by clicking 'Save Expense'. Your expenses are now allocated, and you can submit your report."}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'Can you explain how to add an additional line item when allocating expenses by percent?'}]

3. Ensure that 'Percent' is selected, then click 'Add'.
4. Enter the necessary information and select 'Save'.
5. To add additional line items to the expense, click 'Add'.
6. Select the appropriate department and then click 'Save'. Adjust the percentage amounts as needed; the other line items will automatically adjust to equal 100 percent.
7. Click 'Save' to save the allocations and return to your expense report. The expense will now be displayed as 'Allocated'.
8. To view the allocation for this expense, click the 'Allocated' link. The allocation details will appear in a separate window."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I save the allocation for an expense?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To save the allocation for an expense, follow these steps:

1. From the open expense report, select the check box for the expense you want to allocate, or the check box at the top of the column to select all expenses.
2. Select 'Allocate'.
3. On the 'Allocate' screen, choose to allocate your expenses by 'Percent' or 'Amount'.
4. Enter the appropriate allocation information.
5. Select 'Save'.
6. To add an additional line item, select 'Add', choose the appropriate department, and save it.
7. Adjust the percent or amount as needed so that all values equal 100% or the total expense amount, respectively.
8. To save the allocations and return to your expense report, select 'Save'.
9. Finally, select 'Save Expense' to confirm and save the allocation for the expense."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What does it mean when an expense displays as Allocated?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "When an expense displays as 'Allocated', it means that the expense has been divided and assigned to different projects or departments as specified in the expense report. This can be done by either percent or amount, and the allocation details can be viewed and modified if needed."}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'Can you explain the steps required to allocate an expense by amount in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To allocate an expense by amount in Concur, follow these steps:

1. Select the expense to open it, and then select Allocate.

2. On the Allocate screen, select Amount.

3. To add line items to the expense, select Add.

4. Select the appropriate department for each allocation line item, and then select Save.

5. Modify the amounts as needed. The amounts of the other line items will adjust to equal the total expense amount.

6. Select Save.

7. Finally, to save the allocation for this expense, select Save Expense. Your expenses are now allocated by amount, and you are ready to submit your report.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I convert foreign currency transactions in Concur?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I convert foreign currency transactions in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To convert foreign currency transactions in Concur, follow these steps: 
 1. On the New Expense page, on the Details tab, enter all the appropriate information, including the Transaction Date and Amount.
 2. Select the 'spend' Currency from the dropdown menu.
 3. Depending on the type of rate you receive, select the Reverse link if you need to switch between multiplication of the rate to division of the rate.
 4. After you have completed the necessary fields, select Save Expense. 

 Note: If you have a corporate card, it is recommended to use it when possible while traveling overseas on business. The expense Amount will appear in both the foreign currency and your standard reimbursement currency. The exchange rate automatically comes from XE.com Inc, but you can modify it if needed based on your company's preference."}]

For credit card transactions, the rate is provided by the credit card vendor. 5) Depending on the type of rate you receive, select the Reverse link if you need to switch between multiplication of the rate to division of the rate. 6) After you have completed the necessary fields, select Save Expense. The expense Amount will appear both in the foreign currency and in your standard reimbursement currency. This ensures that all currencies are converted accurately."}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'Can you guide me on how to handle corporate card transactions in Concur when dealing with multiple currencies?'}]
[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How can I copy an expense in Concur?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How can I copy an expense in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To copy an expense in Concur, follow these steps:
1. From the open report, select the expense you want to copy and then select 'Copy'.
2. The new expense will be created with the Expense Type and Amount copied to the new line item. The Date of the transaction will be set to one day after the original expense.
3. Select the copied expense to open it and make any necessary updates, such as adjusting the Transaction Date and Amount.
4. Select 'Save Expense'. The new expense will appear as a new line item on the Manage Expenses page."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I create an expense report for a completed trip?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I create an expense report for a completed trip?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To create an expense report for a completed trip, follow these steps:
1. From the Travel menu on the Upcoming Trips tab, select Expense Trip.
2. On the Create New Report page, complete the required and optional fields as appropriate (required fields are indicated with a red asterisk). Note that some fields might be pre-populated based on your company’s setup.
3. After entering all necessary information, select Create Report. The system will automatically add all credit card transactions related to the trip, including any transactions between your departure and return dates. You will need to correct any Undefined expense types before submitting the report.
4. In the open report, select any expense that requires additional action and update the information.
5. Once the information is updated, select Save Expense.
6. After all expenses in your report are updated, select Submit Report. 
Note: For transactions like Car Rental, there may be attached e-receipts automatically included.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I create an expense report for a completed trip?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To create an expense report for a completed trip, follow these steps:
1. From the Travel menu on the Upcoming Trips tab, select Expense Trip.
2. On the Create New Report page, complete the required and optional fields as appropriate (required fields are indicated with a red asterisk). Note that some fields might be pre-populated based on your company’s setup.
3. After entering all necessary information, select Create Report. The system will automatically add all credit card transactions related to the trip, including any transactions between your departure and return dates. You will need to correct any Undefined expense types before submitting the report.
4. In the open report, select any expense that requires additional action and update the information.
5. Once the information is updated, select Save Expense.

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I create an expense report for a completed trip?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To create an expense report for a completed trip, follow these steps:
1. From the Travel menu on the Upcoming Trips tab, select Expense Trip.
2. On the Create New Report page, complete the required and optional fields as appropriate (required fields are indicated with a red asterisk). Note that some fields might be pre-populated based on your company’s setup.
3. After entering all necessary information, select Create Report. The system will automatically add all credit card transactions related to the trip, including any transactions between your departure and return dates. You will need to correct any Undefined expense types before submitting the report.
4. In the open report, select any expense that requires additional action and update the information.
5. Once the information is updated, select Save Expense.
6. After all expenses in your report are updated, select Submit Report. 
Note: For transactions like Car Rental, there may be attached e-receipts automatically included.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I correct an Undefined expense type?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To correct an Undefined expense type:
1. Access your open expense report by selecting it from your list of reports.
2. Locate the expense entry that has been marked with an Undefined expense type. These entries typically stand out and may have a different visual indicator.
3. Click or select the Undefined expense entry to open the details of that expense.
4. Update the expense type by selecting the correct category from the provided list. You may need to provide additional details or attach receipts if required by your company's policies.
5. Once you have updated the expense type and entered all required information, click or select Save Expense to save your changes.
6. Repeat these steps for any other expenses marked as Undefined.
7. After updating all necessary expenses, you can proceed to submit your report by clicking or selecting Submit Report.

By following these steps, you ensure that all expense entries are appropriately categorized, facilitating accurate reporting and reimbursements."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I start a new expense report in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To start a new expense report in Concur, follow these steps: 1) From the SAP Concur home page, navigate to the Quick Task bar. 2) Place your mouse pointer over 'New', then select 'Start a Report'. 3) On the Create New Report page, fill in the required (marked with a red asterisk) and optional fields as directed by your company, then select 'Create Report'. 4) In the open report, click 'Add Expense' to add credit card transactions or create out-of-pocket expenses. 5) On the Available Expenses tab, choose the expenses you want to add or go to the Create New Expense tab to add new expenses. 6) Select the appropriate expense type as determined by your company. 7) Complete the required fields (marked with a red asterisk) and any additional information, then click 'Save Expense'. 8) After entering all expenses, attaching required receipts, and adding any available cash advances, select 'Submit Report' for approval."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I start a new expense report in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To start a new expense report in Concur, follow these steps: 1) From the SAP Concur home page, navigate to the Quick Task bar. 2) Place your mouse pointer over 'New', then select 'Start a Report'. 3) On the Create New Report page, fill in the required (marked with a red asterisk) and optional fields as directed by your company, then select 'Create Report'. 4) In the open report, click 'Add Expense' to add credit card transactions or create out-of-pocket expenses. 5) On the Available Expenses tab, choose the expenses you want to add or go to the Create New Expense tab to add new expenses. 6) Select the appropriate expense type as determined by your company. 7) Complete the required fields (marked with a red asterisk) and any additional information, then click 'Save Expense'. 8) After entering all expenses, attaching required receipts, and adding any available cash advances, select 'Submit Report' for approval."}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I add receipts to my expense report in Concur?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I start a new expense report in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To start a new expense report in Concur, follow these steps: 1) From the SAP Concur home page, navigate to the Quick Task bar. 2) Place your mouse pointer over 'New', then select 'Start a Report'. 3) On the Create New Report page, fill in the required (marked with a red asterisk) and optional fields as directed by your company, then select 'Create Report'. 4) In the open report, click 'Add Expense' to add credit card transactions or create out-of-pocket expenses. 5) On the Available Expenses tab, choose the expenses you want to add or go to the Create New Expense tab to add new expenses. 6) Select the appropriate expense type as determined by your company. 7) Complete the required fields (marked with a red asterisk) and any additional information, then click 'Save Expense'. 8) After entering all expenses, attaching required receipts, and adding any available cash advances, select 'Submit Report' for approval."}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I add receipts to my expense report in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To add receipts to your expense report in Concur, follow these steps: 1) Open your expense report and go to the specific expense for which you need to attach a receipt. 2) Click on the 'Receipts' tab or, in some versions, you might see a 'Attach Receipt' button. 3) You can upload the receipt from your computer by clicking 'Upload Receipt Image' or use other available options like capturing the receipt through your mobile device if you have the Concur mobile app. 4) Select the file containing the receipt, and ensure it is correctly uploaded and visible. 5) After attaching all necessary receipts, double-check that each expense has the required receipt attached. [{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I create a new expense in my report?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To create a new expense in your report, follow these steps:

1. From the SAP Concur home page, use the Quick Task bar. Place your mouse pointer over 'New' and then select 'Start a Report'.
2. On the Create New Report page, complete the required and optional fields as directed by your company (required fields are indicated with a red asterisk), and then select 'Create Report'.
3. In the open report, select 'Add Expense' to add credit card transactions or to create out-of-pocket expenses.
4. On the Available Expenses tab, select the expenses that you want to add to the report or select the 'Create New Expense' tab to add new expenses.
5. Select the appropriate expense type. Your company determines which expense types are available.
6. The New Expense screen will be displayed. Complete the required fields (marked with a red asterisk), and optionally allocate the expense. You can add additional expense types for this transaction on the Itemizations tab.
7. After entering the appropriate fields, select 'Save Expense'.

Once all expenses are entered for the report, attach the required receipts, add any available cash advances, and select 'Submit Report' for approval."}]

2. Look for the option to attach receipts, which is typically found within the report or expense you are working on.

4. Browse your files and select the receipt image or document you wish to attach. Ensure that you select the correct file, as per your company's requirements.

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I create a new expense in my report?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To create a new expense in your report, follow these steps:

1. From the SAP Concur home page, use the Quick Task bar. Place your mouse pointer over 'New' and then select 'Start a Report'.
2. On the Create New Report page, complete the required and optional fields as directed by your company (required fields are indicated with a red asterisk), and then select 'Create Report'.
3. In the open report, select 'Add Expense' to add credit card transactions or to create out-of-pocket expenses.
4. On the Available Expenses tab, select the expenses that you want to add to the report or select the 'Create New Expense' tab to add new expenses.
5. Select the appropriate expense type. Your company determines which expense types are available.
6. The New Expense screen will be displayed. Complete the required fields (marked with a red asterisk), and optionally allocate the expense. You can add additional expense types for this transaction on the Itemizations tab.
7. After entering the appropriate fields, select 'Save Expense'.

Once all expenses are entered for the report, attach the required receipts, add any available cash advances, and select 'Submit Report' for approval."}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I attach receipts to my expense report?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To attach receipts to your expense report, follow these steps:

1. Once you have entered all your expenses for the report, navigate to the open expense report within SAP Concur.
2. Look for the option to attach receipts, which is typically found within the report or expense you are working on.
3. Select the ‘Attach Receipts’ option. This will allow you to upload the required receipts from your computer or mobile device.
4. Browse your files and select the receipt image or document you wish to attach. Ensure that you select the correct file, as per your company's requirements.
5. Once the receipt is uploaded, it should be linked to the corresponding expense. Repeat this process for any additional receipts.
6. After attaching all required receipts, review your report to ensure all attachments are correctly added.
7. Once verified, proceed to submit your expense report for approval by selecting the 'Submit Report' button.

Following these steps ensures that your expense report is complete and ready for approval."}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I create an expense report that includes previous travel bookings?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How can I request a cash advance on SAP Concur?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How can I request a cash advance on SAP Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To request a cash advance on SAP Concur, follow these steps:
1. From the SAP Concur home page, on the Quick Task bar, place your mouse pointer over 'New', and then select 'New Cash Advance'.
2. Enter the required information for the cash advance. Fields with a red bar are mandatory.
3. Select 'Cash Advance Timeline'.
4. On the Cash Advance Timeline page, select 'Edit'.
5. Search for and select the appropriate approver, then select 'Save Workflow'.
6. Select 'Close'.
7. Select 'Submit'.
Once the cash advance request is approved, you will receive the cash for your trip. When your trip starts, add the cash advance to the appropriate expense report."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How can I view and select an approver for my cash advance request?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To view and select an approver for your cash advance request, follow these steps:

1. From the SAP Concur home page, on the Quick Task bar, place your mouse pointer over New, and then select New Cash Advance.
2. Enter the required information for the cash advance on the New Cash Advance page.
3. Select Cash Advance Timeline.
4. On the Cash Advance Timeline page, select Edit.
5. Search for and select the appropriate approver, and then select Save Workflow.
6. Select Close.
7. Finally, select Submit to complete the request.

Once your request is approved, you will receive the cash for your trip.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How can I delete an expense report in SAP Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To delete an expense report in SAP Concur, follow these steps: 1. From the SAP Concur home page, select 'Open Reports'. 2. On the Manage Expenses screen, select the report that you want to delete. 3. Select 'Delete Report'. After you delete the report, items that came from your Available Expenses (card charges or e-receipts) are moved back to your Available Expenses. Manually created expenses are deleted and cannot be recovered. 4. Select 'Delete' to confirm the removal of the report."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do you begin to itemize an expense in Concur?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do you begin to itemize an expense in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To begin itemizing an expense in Concur, follow these steps: 1. In your expense report, select the expense to open the expense details. 2. Select the Itemizations tab. 3. On the Itemizations tab, select Create Itemization. The expense amount, itemized amount, and remaining amount are listed on the Itemizations tab. 4. Select the Expense Type that applies to the first itemization. The page will refresh, displaying the required and optional fields for the selected expense type. 5. Complete the appropriate fields. 6. If this is a personal expense, select the Personal Expense (do not reimburse) check box to indicate that your company will not reimburse you for the expenditure. 7. After completing the information for each itemization, select Save Itemization. 8. Continue itemizing the expense until the remaining amount is $0.00. Once you have completed itemizing the expense, a green checkmark will appear next to the remaining amount of $0.00, indicating that the itemization is complete.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do you create a new itemization for an expense?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do you create a new itemization for an expense?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To create a new itemization for an expense, follow these steps: 

1. In your expense report, select the expense to open the expense details. 

2. Select the 'Itemizations' tab. 

3. On the 'Itemizations' tab, select 'Create Itemization'. The expense Amount, the Itemized amount, and the Remaining amount are listed on the 'Itemizations' tab. 

4. Select the Expense Type that applies to the first itemization. The page will refresh, displaying the required and optional fields for the selected expense type (required fields are marked with a red asterisk). 

5. Complete the appropriate fields. 

6. If this is a personal expense, select the 'Personal Expense (do not reimburse)' check box. Designating an expense as personal means that your company will not reimburse you for the expenditure. 

7. After you complete entering the information for each itemization, select 'Save Itemization'. 

8. Continue itemizing the expense until the Remaining amount is $0.00. 

Once you have completed itemizing the expense, a green checkmark will appear next to the Remaining amount of $0.00, indicating completion."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I start itemizing my nightly lodging expenses in Concur?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I start itemizing my nightly lodging expenses in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To start itemizing your nightly lodging expenses in Concur, follow these steps: 

1. Select the Itemizations tab. This tab will display the amount remaining that requires itemization. 
2. Depending on whether your hotel room rate was the same every night or not, select the appropriate option. For example, if you had a different rate for the last night, select 'Not the Same'. 
3. Enter the Room Rate (per night) and Room Tax (per night) for each night. You can also use additional Tax 2 and Tax 3 fields if needed. 
4. Select 'Save Itemization'. 
5. For other hotel expenses, select 'Create Itemization' to continue itemizing until the remaining amount is $0. 
6. Enter the recurring expense amount, such as parking, and select the 'Recurring Every Night' checkbox. 
7. Select 'Save Itemization' after entering the necessary details. 
8. Once all charges are itemized, a green checkmark will appear, indicating that all alerts for this expense are cleared. 
9. Select 'Save Expense'. 
10. Finally, select 'Submit Report' to submit your expense report for approval. 

If itemizing a hotel bill from a foreign country, ensure that all amounts are in the foreign currency. Any small remaining amount must be itemized before you can submit your report."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I continue itemizing hotel expenses after entering room rates?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To continue itemizing hotel expenses after entering room rates, follow these steps:

1. Select the 'Itemizations' tab, which displays the remaining amount that requires itemization.
2. Choose whether your hotel room rate was 'The Same Every Night' or 'Not the Same.' For example, if the rate is different for the last night, select 'Not the Same.'
3. Scroll down to enter the Room Rate (per night) and Room Tax (per night) for each night. You can also use the Tax 2 and Tax 3 fields to enter additional tax amounts.
4. Select 'Save Itemization.'
5. Click 'Create Itemization' to continue itemizing your hotel expenses until the remaining amount is zero. For instance, you can add a recurring parking expense for each night by entering the amount for one night and selecting the 'Recurring Every Night' checkbox.
6. After entering all itemizations, ensure the remaining amount is $0.00. A green checkmark will appear, indicating that all alerts for the expense have been cleared.
7. Select 'Save Expense.'
8. Finally, select 'Submit Report' to send your expense report for approval. If itemizing a hotel bill from a foreign country, enter the amounts in that foreign currency. If there is a small remaining amount after itemizing all charges, create a single itemization for the remaining amount before submitting your report."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I ensure all my charges have been itemized?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To ensure all your charges have been itemized, follow these steps:

1. Select the Itemizations tab, which will display the amount remaining that requires itemization.
2. Determine if your hotel room rate was the same every night or not. If not, select 'Not the Same' and enter the different rates and corresponding taxes for each night.
3. Click 'Save Itemization' after entering the room rate and tax amounts.
4. Continue to itemize additional expenses, such as recurring parking charges, by selecting 'Create Itemization,' entering the amount, and saving the itemization.
5. Make sure the remaining amount is $0.00. A green checkmark will appear indicating that all alerts for the expense have been cleared.
6. Finally, select 'Save Expense' and then 'Submit Report' to submit your expense report for approval. If you itemize charges from a foreign country and have a small remaining amount, create a single itemization for it before submitting your report."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How can I recall a cash advance in SAP Concur?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How can I recall a cash advance in SAP Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To recall a cash advance in SAP Concur, follow these steps: 

1. From the SAP Concur home page, select the Home menu and then select Expense.
2. Select Cash Advances.
3. In the Active Cash Advances section, select the appropriate cash advance that you need to recall before it is approved.
4. Select Recall.
5. Confirm the action by selecting Yes. The cash advance will be recalled. 

If you wish to delete the recalled cash advance, follow these additional steps: 

6. Select the recalled cash advance to open it.
7. Select the Bin icon and then confirm the deletion by selecting Yes. The cash advance request will be permanently deleted.'}]

2. On the Approvals page, you will see a list of expense reports awaiting your approval. Select the Report Name of the expense report you wish to review.
3. The expense report will open, displaying all the report expenses in the Expense Reports list. Any exceptions will be shown in the Exceptions section.
4. After reviewing the expenses, receipts, and any exceptions, select 'Approve' to approve the expense report.

1. Go to the My Tasks section on the SAP Concur home page.

2. Select 'Required Approvals'. This will take you to the Approvals page where the number of expense reports awaiting your approval is displayed.

3. In the Approvals pane, to open an expense report for review, select the Report Name. This will show all the report expenses in the Expense Reports list.

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I open an expense report for review?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To open an expense report for review, follow these steps: 

1. Go to the SAP Concur home page and locate the 'My Tasks' section. 
2. Select 'Required Approvals' from this section. 
3. On the Approvals page, you will see a list of expense reports awaiting approval. 
4. Select the Report Name of the expense report you want to open and review. 
5. Review the expenses, receipts, and any exceptions listed. 
6. Once you have reviewed everything, select 'Approve' to approve the expense report. 
After approving the report, it will no longer appear in your 'Reports Pending your Approval' list."}]

Here are the steps you should follow:

1. Identify the specific exception(s) listed in the Exceptions section of the expense report.
2. Evaluate the details of each exception to understand the issue, such as policy violations or missing receipts.
3. If necessary, seek clarification from the employee who submitted the report to resolve the exception(s).
4. Depending on the nature of the exception, you may choose to send the report back to the employee for correction or provide the necessary justification to override the exception.
5. Document any actions or communications related to the exception handling for audit purposes.
6. Once all exceptions have been satisfactorily addressed, proceed with the approval of the expense report by selecting 'Approve'. This ensures the report is correct and compliant with your organization's policies."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'Where can you see exceptions in a report?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'You can see exceptions in a report in the Exceptions section.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'What should I do if I see exceptions in an expense report when reviewing it?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'If you see exceptions in an expense report when reviewing it, you should review the exceptions along with the rest of the expense details and receipts before deciding to approve or take any other necessary action.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'Can you explain the steps to open an expense report for review from the My Tasks section?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To open an expense report for review from the My Tasks section: 
1. Go to the My Tasks section on the SAP Concur home page. 
2. Select 'Required Approvals'. This will bring you to the Approvals page, where you will see the number of expense reports awaiting approval. 
3. To open an expense report, select the 'Report Name'. 
4. Review the expense details, receipts, and any exceptions listed in the Exceptions section. 
5. After reviewing, select 'Approve' to approve the expense report. Once approved, the report will no longer appear in your Reports Pending your Approval list."}]

1. Go to the SAP Concur home page and navigate to the My Tasks section. 
2. Select the Required Approvals option. 
3. On the Approvals page, you will see the list of expense reports awaiting your approval. 
4. Click on the Report Name of the expense report you wish to review. This will open the report and display all related expenses. 
5. Review the expenses, receipts, and any exceptions listed in the Exceptions section. 
6. After reviewing, you can select Approve to approve the expense report. Once approved, the report will no longer appear in your Reports Pending your Approval list.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How long can it take for some transactions to appear in Concur?'}]
[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How long can it take for some transactions to appear in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'It can take up to 10 days for some transactions to appear in Concur.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How long can it take for some transactions to appear in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'It can take up to 10 days for some transactions to appear in Concur.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "What should I do if my transactions are still missing after 10 days and they don't appear on my bank statement either?"}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How long can it take for some transactions to appear in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'It can take up to 10 days for some transactions to appear in Concur.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "What should I do if my transactions are still missing after 10 days and they don't appear on my bank statement either?"}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "If your transactions are still missing after 10 days and they don't appear on your bank statement either, you should perform the following troubleshooting steps: 1. Log out, and then log back in to SAP Concur. 2. Ensure that the purchase was made on the correct card and was posted to your statement. 3. Click the Available Expenses link to see if the charges have appeared. 4. Search for transactions via time frame, which will show charges already included in the reports. 5. If you have a delegate, verify that the delegate has not added the charge to a recent report."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What should I do if my trip expenses are not showing on the Add Expense screen?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What should I do if my trip expenses are not showing on the Add Expense screen?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'If your trip expenses are not showing on the Add Expense screen, you will need to troubleshoot the missing transactions. Here are the steps to follow:

1. Note that it can take up to 10 days for some transactions to appear.
2. Check your bank statement to see if the missing corporate card charges are listed. If they are listed, contact an Administrator to check if the transactions are hidden.
3. If the missing charges are not on your bank statement, proceed with the following steps:
   - Log out, and then log back in to SAP Concur.
   - Ensure that the purchase was made on the correct card and was posted to your statement.
   - Click the Available Expenses link to see if the charges have appeared.
   - Search for transactions via time frame to show charges already included in the reports.
   - If you have a delegate, verify that the delegate has not added the charge to a recent report.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What should I do if my trip expenses are not showing on the Add Expense screen?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'If your trip expenses are not showing on the Add Expense screen, you will need to troubleshoot the missing transactions. Here are the steps to follow:

1. Note that it can take up to 10 days for some transactions to appear.
2. Check your bank statement to see if the missing corporate card charges are listed. If they are listed, contact an Administrator to check if the transactions are hidden.
3. If the missing charges are not on your bank statement, proceed with the following steps:
   - Log out, and then log back in to SAP Concur.
   - Ensure that the purchase was made on the correct card and was posted to your statement.
   - Click the Available Expenses link to see if the charges have appeared.
   - Search for transactions via time frame to show charges already included in the reports.
   - If you have a delegate, verify that the delegate has not added the charge to a recent report.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I check if an Administrator has hidden the transactions?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What should I do if my trip expenses are not showing on the Add Expense screen?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'If your trip expenses are not showing on the Add Expense screen, you will need to troubleshoot the missing transactions. Here are the steps to follow:

   - Ensure that the purchase was made on the correct card and was posted to your statement.
   - Click the Available Expenses link to see if the charges have appeared.
   - Search for transactions via time frame to show charges already included in the reports.

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I add my SAP Concur account to an authenticator app?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I add my SAP Concur account to an authenticator app?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To add your SAP Concur account to an authenticator app, follow these steps:

1. Sign in to SAP Concur by entering your Username, email address, or SSO code on the Sign In screen.
2. Click 'Next' and then enter your Password. If this is your initial login, enter the temporary password provided to you.
3. After entering your password, select 'Sign In.'
4. You will be prompted to set up two-factor authentication to continue signing in.
5. To add your SAP Concur account to the authenticator app, scan the QR code displayed on the Sign In page using an authenticator app (such as Microsoft Authenticator or Google Authenticator). If you can't scan the QR code, select the 'Set up manually with a key' link.
6. After scanning the QR code or entering the key manually, copy the six-digit code generated by the app and enter it into the Authentication Code field on the SAP Concur Sign In page.
7. Select 'Sign In' to complete the process."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I add my SAP Concur account to an authenticator app?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To add your SAP Concur account to an authenticator app, follow these steps:

1. Sign in to SAP Concur by entering your Username, email address, or SSO code on the Sign In screen.
2. Click 'Next' and then enter your Password. If this is your initial login, enter the temporary password provided to you.
3. After entering your password, select 'Sign In.'
4. You will be prompted to set up two-factor authentication to continue signing in.
5. To add your SAP Concur account to the authenticator app, scan the QR code displayed on the Sign In page using an authenticator app (such as Microsoft Authenticator or Google Authenticator). If you can't scan the QR code, select the 'Set up manually with a key' link.
6. After scanning the QR code or entering the key manually, copy the six-digit code generated by the app and enter it into the Authentication Code field on the SAP Concur Sign In page.
7. Select 'Sign In' to complete the process."}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "What should I do if I can't scan the QR code while setting up two-factor authentication on SAP Concur?"}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I add my SAP Concur account to an authenticator app?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To add your SAP Concur account to an authenticator app, follow these steps:

1. Sign in to SAP Concur by entering your Username, email address, or SSO code on the Sign In screen.

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I activate Available Receipts in SAP Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To activate Available Receipts in SAP Concur, follow these steps: 
1. From the SAP Concur home page, select the Profile symbol, and then select Profile Settings. 
2. On the Profile Options screen, select Personal Information. 
3. Scroll down to the Email Addresses section, select Verify, and then select OK. 
4. Enter the code sent by SAP Concur in the Enter Code field, and then select OK. 

You can now send and receive email images for use on your expense reports. Email addresses must be unique and cannot be shared aliases. Once verified, you can attach available receipt images to your expenses.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I activate Available Receipts in SAP Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To activate Available Receipts in SAP Concur, follow these steps:

1. From an open expense report, you will see a list of expenses. An alert is displayed requiring you to attach a receipt image to the expense.
2. Select the expense line item to view the details.
3. To clear the alert for the required receipt, from the expense Details tab, select Add Receipt. Your available receipts are displayed.
4. Select the appropriate receipt.
5. Select Attach.
6. The receipt is attached, and all alerts have been cleared.
7. Select Save Expense. You can view and edit receipts from the expense list screen.
8. To view your receipts, select the receipt icon.
9. To remove a receipt from an expense, select Remove.
10. Select Yes to confirm that you want to detach the image and move it to the Available Receipts section.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How can I attach receipt images to my expenses in SAP Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To attach receipt images to your expenses in SAP Concur, follow these steps: 

1. Verify your Profile Email Address with SAP Concur: 
   - From the SAP Concur home page, select the Profile symbol, and then select Profile Settings. 
   - On the Profile Options screen, select Personal Information. 
   - Scroll down to the Email Addresses section, select Verify, and then select OK. 
   - Enter the verification code sent to you by SAP Concur in the Enter Code field and select OK. 

2. With your email address verified, you can now attach receipt images to your expenses: 
   - Open your expense report, and you will see a list of expenses. 
   - Select the expense line item to view details. 
   - From the expense Details tab, select Add Receipt. 
   - Your available receipts are displayed. 
   - Select the appropriate receipt and then select Attach. 
   - Finally, select Save Expense.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How can I attach receipt images to my expenses in SAP Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To attach receipt images to your expenses in SAP Concur, follow these steps: 

1. Verify your Profile Email Address with SAP Concur: 
   - From the SAP Concur home page, select the Profile symbol, and then select Profile Settings. 
   - On the Profile Options screen, select Personal Information. 
   - Scroll down to the Email Addresses section, select Verify, and then select OK. 
   - Enter the verification code sent to you by SAP Concur in the Enter Code field and select OK. 

2. With your email address verified, you can now attach receipt images to your expenses: 
   - Open your expense report, and you will see a list of expenses. 
   - Select the expense line item to view details. 
   - From the expense Details tab, select Add Receipt. 
   - Your available receipts are displayed.

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How can I attach receipt images to my expenses in SAP Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To attach receipt images to your expenses in SAP Concur, follow these steps:

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I attach a receipt to an expense line item in SAP Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To attach a receipt to an expense line item in SAP Concur, follow these steps: 1. Verify your Profile Email Address by selecting the Profile symbol from the SAP Concur home page, then select Profile Settings. On the Profile Options screen, select Personal Information. Scroll down to the Email Addresses section, select Verify, and follow the instructions to verify your email address. 2. From an open expense report, select the expense line item to view the details. 3. From the expense Details tab, select Add Receipt. 4. Your available receipts will be displayed. Select the appropriate receipt and then select Attach. 5. Select Save Expense to complete the attachment process. To view the receipt, select the receipt icon. To remove the receipt, select Remove and confirm that you want to move it to the Available Receipts section.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What steps should I follow to clear the receipt alert in my expense report?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To clear the receipt alert in your expense report, follow these steps: 1. From the SAP Concur home page, select the Profile symbol, then select Profile Settings. 2. On the Profile Options screen, select Personal Information. 3. Scroll down to the Email Addresses section, select Verify, and then select OK. 4. Type the code sent by SAP Concur in the Enter Code field and select OK. 5. Open your expense report and find the expense line item with the receipt alert. 6. Select the expense line item to view its details. 7. From the expense Details tab, select Add Receipt. Your available receipts will be displayed. 8. Select the appropriate receipt and then select Attach. 9. Select Save Expense. The receipt is now attached, and the alert is cleared. 10. To view receipts, select the receipt icon from the expense list screen. 11. To remove a receipt, select Remove and then Yes to confirm that you want to detach the image and move it to the Available Receipts section.'}]
