[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What are Purchasing Cards (P-Cards) and how do they integrate with Company Bill Statements?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What are Purchasing Cards (P-Cards) and how do they integrate with Company Bill Statements?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "Purchasing Cards (P-Cards) are integrated with Company Bill Statements to provide companies with greater control and visibility over the purchasing process. The integration works by processing Company Bill Statements similarly to regular expense reports. An administrator configures the Purchase Card settings and sets the timeframe for the report. These statements are created automatically for each billing cycle and are accessible from the Open Reports section. However, users cannot select quick expenses or manually enter expenses while working on a statement report. Transactions in these reports are categorized, with exceptions noted, and users may need to edit some expenses, attach receipts, and submit the report. If there are more than 500 transactions in a statement period, an addendum report is created. The approval workflow can be viewed or modified, and reports can only be submitted as per the administrator's timeline. Once submitted, reports are sent for approval."}]

Once submitted, reports are sent for approval."}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I assign Undefined transactions to an expense type within a Company Bill Statement report in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To assign Undefined transactions to an expense type within a Company Bill Statement report in Concur, follow these steps:

1. Open the Company Bill Statement report from the Open Reports section in the My Tasks section.
2. Identify the transactions that are not assigned to an expense type.
3. Open the undefined transaction.
4. Select the Expense Type dropdown arrow and choose the appropriate expense type.
5. Attach any required receipts using the Add Receipt button if necessary.
6. Select Save Expense to save the changes.

Continue to update expense types and attach receipts as needed throughout the statement period. Once all transactions are properly categorized and any required receipts are attached, you can submit the report for approval when allowed by your administrator.'}]

Once all transactions are properly categorized and any required receipts are attached, you can submit the report for approval when allowed by your administrator.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'Can you explain how to review and modify the Report Details and Report Timeline in a Company Bill Statement report within Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To review and modify the Report Details and Report Timeline in a Company Bill Statement report within Concur, follow these steps:

1. Open the Company Bill Statement report from the Open Reports section in the My Tasks section.

2. To modify the report details:
  - Select the Report Details dropdown menu.
  - Click on Report Header.
  - Modify the necessary Report Header fields as needed (note that the Business Purpose field is automatically pre-populated with the date range for the statement report).
  - Click Save.

3. To view or modify the approval workflow:
  - Select the Report Details dropdown menu.
  - Click on Report Timeline.
  - Depending on your company configuration, you can modify the assigned Manager Approval or Back Office Approval using the Edit link.
  - If you modify the Approval Flow, you can submit the report from within that pop-up window, although the submission may be restricted by the administrator until after the period closes or a few days later.
  - Click Close.

4. When you are finished with the report details, select Submit Report to submit the Company Bill Statement report for approval. You will then be returned to the Active Reports screen.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How does the process for Company Bill Statements differ from a regular expense report?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How does the process for Company Bill Statements differ from a regular expense report?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'The process for Company Bill Statements using Purchasing Cards, or P-Cards, integrates the entire purchasing process in a more controlled and visible manner compared to a regular expense report. While Company Bill Statements are processed similarly to regular expense reports, there are key differences: 1. **Automatic Creation:** Company Bill Statements are automatically created for each billing cycle based on settings configured by an administrator. This is different from regular expense reports which are typically created manually. 2. **Accessibility:** These statements are accessible from the Open Reports section, streamlining access and management. 3. **Transaction Handling:** Unlike regular expense reports where you can manually enter expenses or select quick expenses, Company Bill Statements do not allow for this. All transactions are pre-categorized, though you may need to edit and assign undefined transactions to specific expense types. 4. **Receipt Management:** Receipts are attached at the entry level using the Add Receipt button, and depending on company configuration, entry-level expenses can be allocated as well. 5. **Automated Details:** The Business Purpose field and other details are pre-populated and modifications to the automated report details can be made via the Report Details dropdown menu. 6. **Approval Workflow:** The approval workflow can be viewed or modified depending on the company’s configuration using the Report Timeline option. Submission of reports is also controlled by administrative settings. 7. **Continuous Updates:** You can continually update expense types and attach receipts throughout the statement period, which offers more flexibility compared to regular expense reports. 8. **Addendum Reports:** If transactions exceed 500 within a statement period or if additional transactions are imported after submission, addendum reports are automatically created to manage the overflow. Lastly, once all details are finalized, the report is submitted for approval and you are returned to the Active Reports screen.'}]

The option to allocate expenses will be available based on how your company has configured its system."}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'Can you tell me more about how to modify the approval workflow for a Company Bill Statement report in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To modify the approval workflow for a Company Bill Statement report in Concur, follow these steps:

1. Open the Company Bill Statement report you wish to modify by navigating to the My Tasks section and selecting the report under Open Reports.

2. To view or modify the approval workflow, click on the Report Details dropdown menu and select Report Timeline.

3. Depending on your company configuration, you can modify the assigned Manager Approval or Back Office Approval that was initially set by your administrator by using the Edit link.

4. After making the necessary changes, you can choose to submit the report directly from within the pop-up window where you made the modifications. Be aware that your administrator determines when you are allowed to submit the report. In some cases, you might not be allowed to submit the report until after the period closes or even several days post-closing.

5. Select Close to finalize the changes.

Remember, you can continually update expense types and attach receipts throughout the statement period.

When you have completed all necessary modifications, select Submit Report to send the Company Bill Statement report for approval. You will then be returned to the Active Reports screen.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What steps should I take to submit the Company Bill Statement report?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To submit the Company Bill Statement report, follow these steps: 1. Open the Company Bill Statement report from the 'My Tasks' section under 'Open Reports'. 2. Categorize any undefined transactions by opening each expense, selecting the appropriate expense type from the dropdown menu, and then saving the expense. 3. Attach required receipts to each entry using the 'Add Receipt' button. 4. If necessary, modify the report details by selecting 'Report Details' > 'Report Header', then update the fields as needed and save. 5. To view or modify the approval workflow, go to 'Report Details' > 'Report Timeline'. If allowed by your configuration, you can modify the assigned Manager Approval or Back Office Approval and submit the report directly from within that pop-up window. 6. Continually update expense types and attach receipts throughout the statement period. 7. When all details are finalized, select 'Submit Report'. The report will then be submitted for approval, and you will be returned to the 'Active Reports' screen."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What is Expense Assistant in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'Expense Assistant in Concur is a feature that automatically adds all expenses from your Available Expenses list to any open expense report. This can be an expense report created by the user or one auto-created by Expense Assistant. It continuously adds new incoming expenses that match the calendar month of the open report. The feature is activated by your company administrator, who might configure it to create monthly or trip-based reports, or both. Automatically created reports are accessible on the Expense page, and users can modify, fix alerts, add or delete expenses, and attach required receipts before submitting for approval. Once submitted, expenses can be added to a new report if they fall within the same month, and deleted expenses return to the Available Expenses section. Duplicate expenses are matched to reports, including those with a Returned status.'}]

1. Ensure that your company administrator has activated Expense Assistant for your organization, as they control its activation.
2. From the SAP Concur home page, find the 'My Tasks' section and select 'Open Reports.'
3. Once activated, Expense Assistant will automatically name a monthly expense report and import any relevant expenses for that month. You can access and modify these automatically created reports as needed.

Benefits of using Expense Assistant include:
- Automatic creation and naming of expense reports, saving you time and reducing manual work.
- Continuous addition of new incoming expenses to the appropriate monthly report.
- Ability to view and manage all your expenses in a single report, ensuring that no expense is missed.
- Efficient handling of duplicate expenses and deleted expenses, ensuring accurate reporting and preventing re-entry of deleted items."}]

The report will then be submitted and pending approval from your manager.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'Can you explain how to enable Expense Assistant and what benefits it provides?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To enable Expense Assistant, follow these steps:

1. Ensure that your company administrator has activated Expense Assistant for your organization, as they control its activation.
2. From the SAP Concur home page, find the 'My Tasks' section and select 'Open Reports.'
3. Once activated, Expense Assistant will automatically name a monthly expense report and import any relevant expenses for that month. You can access and modify these automatically created reports as needed.

Benefits of using Expense Assistant include:
- Automatic creation and naming of expense reports, saving you time and reducing manual work.
- Continuous addition of new incoming expenses to the appropriate monthly report.
- Ability to view and manage all your expenses in a single report, ensuring that no expense is missed.
- Efficient handling of duplicate expenses and deleted expenses, ensuring accurate reporting and preventing re-entry of deleted items."}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'What happens if there are expenses from the same month that are imported after I have already submitted my expense report?'}]

From the SAP Concur home page, in the 'My Tasks' section, select 'Open Reports'. 2. The Expense Assistant names an automatically created expense report for each month and imports any expenses that have occurred. You can modify the report as needed. 3. To modify the report, select the appropriate report. 4. Fix any alerts, and add, edit, or delete your expenses as necessary. Attach any required receipts before submitting the report for approval. 5. When you are finished modifying the report, select 'Submit Report'. 6. In the 'Report Totals' window, select 'Submit Report' again, and then select 'Close'. The report is then submitted and pending approval from a manager. If there are additional same-month expenses imported into the system, they are added to a new automatically created report."}]

Once activated, you can access your automatically created reports on the Expense page of SAP Concur. Here's how to modify reports: 

1. From the SAP Concur home page in the My Tasks section, select Open Reports. 
2. Select the appropriate report you wish to modify. 
3. Fix any alerts, and add, edit, or delete your expenses as necessary. Attach any required receipts before submitting the report for approval. 
4. When finished modifying the report, select Submit Report. 
5. In the Report Totals window, select Submit Report again, and then select Close.

You can modify the report as needed, fix any alerts, and attach any required receipts before submitting the report for approval.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I enable Expense Assistant?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To enable Expense Assistant, your company administrator must activate it. Once activated, you can access your automatically created reports on the Expense page of SAP Concur. Here's how to modify reports: 

1. From the SAP Concur home page in the My Tasks section, select Open Reports. 
2. Select the appropriate report you wish to modify. 
3. Fix any alerts, and add, edit, or delete your expenses as necessary. Attach any required receipts before submitting the report for approval. 
4. When finished modifying the report, select Submit Report. 
5. In the Report Totals window, select Submit Report again, and then select Close. 

Your report will then be submitted and pending approval from a manager. [{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What is the purpose of the American Express Business Card connection in SAP Concur?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What is the purpose of the American Express Business Card connection in SAP Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'The purpose of the American Express Business Card connection in SAP Concur is to provide a direct integration that allows users to import expense transactions from American Express directly into Concur Expense. This connection offers functionalities such as automatic daily refresh of transactions, compatibility with SAP Concur Expense Assistant, management of transactions by the primary cardholder, support for delegate and proxy capabilities, handling of foreign transaction currencies, and the ability to view available transactions. Only admins can delete transactions, which enhances compliance and visibility for administrators.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What is the purpose of the American Express Business Card connection in SAP Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'The purpose of the American Express Business Card connection in SAP Concur is to provide a direct integration that allows users to import expense transactions from American Express directly into Concur Expense. This connection offers functionalities such as automatic daily refresh of transactions, compatibility with SAP Concur Expense Assistant, management of transactions by the primary cardholder, support for delegate and proxy capabilities, handling of foreign transaction currencies, and the ability to view available transactions. Only admins can delete transactions, which enhances compliance and visibility for administrators.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'Can you explain the steps to register an American Express Business Card in SAP Concur?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What is the purpose of the American Express Business Card connection in SAP Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'The purpose of the American Express Business Card connection in SAP Concur is to provide a direct integration that allows users to import expense transactions from American Express directly into Concur Expense. This connection offers functionalities such as automatic daily refresh of transactions, compatibility with SAP Concur Expense Assistant, management of transactions by the primary cardholder, support for delegate and proxy capabilities, handling of foreign transaction currencies, and the ability to view available transactions. Only admins can delete transactions, which enhances compliance and visibility for administrators.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'Can you explain the steps to register an American Express Business Card in SAP Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To register an American Express Business Card in SAP Concur, follow these steps:

1. Select the *Profile* icon, and then select *Profile Settings*.
2. In the *Expense Settings* section, select *Expense Credit Cards*.
3. Select *Add Amex Business Card*.
4. In the *You are now leaving Concur* box, select *Continue*.
5. On the *Card Data Access User Agreement*, read the agreement, select the *I Accept the Terms and Conditions* checkbox, and then select *Continue*.
6. On the American Express login page, enter your login credentials, then select *Log In*.
7. On the *Authorize access to Concur* disclaimer, read the information and then select *Continue*.
8. On the American Express authorization page, select the checkbox for each card you want to synchronize.
9. Select *Authorize* to synchronize cards.
10. Select *Return to Concur*.
11. In the message to confirm card registration, select *OK*.

After registration, the business card will appear on the *Expense Credit Cards* page in Profile settings. Concur Expense will import transactions from the last 90 days, and new transactions will be synchronized automatically on a daily basis. You can view transactions under *Available Expenses* on the home page to add them to your expense reports.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What is the purpose of the American Express Business Card connection in SAP Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'The purpose of the American Express Business Card connection in SAP Concur is to provide a direct integration that allows users to import expense transactions from American Express directly into Concur Expense. This connection offers functionalities such as automatic daily refresh of transactions, compatibility with SAP Concur Expense Assistant, management of transactions by the primary cardholder, support for delegate and proxy capabilities, handling of foreign transaction currencies, and the ability to view available transactions. Only admins can delete transactions, which enhances compliance and visibility for administrators.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'Can you explain the steps to register an American Express Business Card in SAP Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To register an American Express Business Card in SAP Concur, follow these steps:

1. Select the *Profile* icon, and then select *Profile Settings*.
2. In the *Expense Settings* section, select *Expense Credit Cards*.
3. Select *Add Amex Business Card*.
4. In the *You are now leaving Concur* box, select *Continue*.
5. On the *Card Data Access User Agreement*, read the agreement, select the *I Accept the Terms and Conditions* checkbox, and then select *Continue*.
6. On the American Express login page, enter your login credentials, then select *Log In*.
7. On the *Authorize access to Concur* disclaimer, read the information and then select *Continue*.
8. On the American Express authorization page, select the checkbox for each card you want to synchronize.
9. Select *Authorize* to synchronize cards.
10. Select *Return to Concur*.
11. In the message to confirm card registration, select *OK*.

After registration, the business card will appear on the *Expense Credit Cards* page in Profile settings. Concur Expense will import transactions from the last 90 days, and new transactions will be synchronized automatically on a daily basis. You can view transactions under *Available Expenses* on the home page to add them to your expense reports.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "If a supplemental cardholder doesn't have an American Express user login, how can they create an account on the MYCA website to register their card in SAP Concur?"}]

Each cardholder (primary or supplemental) must register their card individually.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "If a supplemental cardholder doesn't have an American Express user login, how can they register their card on Concur?"}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "If a supplemental cardholder doesn't have an American Express user login, they need to first create an account on the American Express MYCA (Manage Your Card Account) website before they can register their card on Concur."}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'What steps should supplemental cardholders follow to create an account on the American Express MYCA website before registering their card on Concur?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'Can a primary cardholder register supplemental cards on behalf of other employees?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'No, a primary cardholder cannot register supplemental cards on behalf of other employees. Each cardholder (primary or supplemental) must register their card individually.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "If a supplemental cardholder doesn't have an American Express user login, how can they register their card on Concur?"}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "If a supplemental cardholder doesn't have an American Express user login, they need to first create an account on the American Express MYCA (Manage Your Card Account) website before they can register their card on Concur."}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'What steps should supplemental cardholders follow to create an account on the American Express MYCA website before registering their card on Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "Supplemental cardholders should follow these steps to create an account on the American Express MYCA website before registering their card on Concur:

1. Visit the American Express MYCA (Manage Your Card Account) website.
2. Select the option to create a new account.
3. Follow the on-screen instructions to enter personal and card information as required to set up the account.
4. Once the account is created, log in with the new credentials.

After creating the account, they can proceed to register their card on Concur by following these steps:

1. Select the Profile icon, and then choose Profile Settings.
2. In the Expense Settings section, select Expense Credit Cards.
3. Click Add Amex Business Card.
4. In the 'You are now leaving Concur' box, select Continue.
5. On the Card Data Access User Agreement page, read the agreement, select the checkbox for 'I Accept the Terms and Conditions,' and then click Continue.
6. On the American Express login page, enter the new login credentials and select Log In.
7. Read and accept the disclaimer on the 'Authorize access to Concur' page, then select Continue.
8. On the American Express authorization page, select the checkbox for each card to synchronize and then select Authorize.
9. Click Return to Concur.
10. Confirm card registration by selecting OK in the message.
The registered business card will now appear on the Expense Credit Cards page in Profile settings.

For more information, refer to the 'Register a Card' topic in the Concur Expense Standard Edition End User Help."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'Can a primary cardholder register supplemental cards on behalf of other employees?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'No, a primary cardholder cannot register supplemental cards on behalf of other employees. Each cardholder (primary or supplemental) must register their card individually.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "If a supplemental cardholder doesn't have an American Express user login, how can they register their card on Concur?"}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "If a supplemental cardholder doesn't have an American Express user login, they need to first create an account on the American Express MYCA (Manage Your Card Account) website before they can register their card on Concur."}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'What steps should supplemental cardholders follow to create an account on the American Express MYCA website before registering their card on Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "Supplemental cardholders should follow these steps to create an account on the American Express MYCA website before registering their card on Concur:

1. Visit the American Express MYCA (Manage Your Card Account) website.
2. Select the option to create a new account.
3. Follow the on-screen instructions to enter personal and card information as required to set up the account.
4. Once the account is created, log in with the new credentials.

After creating the account, they can proceed to register their card on Concur by following these steps:

1. Select the Profile icon, and then choose Profile Settings.
2. In the Expense Settings section, select Expense Credit Cards.
3. Click Add Amex Business Card.
4. In the 'You are now leaving Concur' box, select Continue.
5. On the Card Data Access User Agreement page, read the agreement, select the checkbox for 'I Accept the Terms and Conditions,' and then click Continue.
6. On the American Express login page, enter the new login credentials and select Log In.
7. Read and accept the disclaimer on the 'Authorize access to Concur' page, then select Continue.
8. On the American Express authorization page, select the checkbox for each card to synchronize and then select Authorize.
9. Click Return to Concur.
10. Confirm card registration by selecting OK in the message.
The registered business card will now appear on the Expense Credit Cards page in Profile settings.

For more information, refer to the 'Register a Card' topic in the Concur Expense Standard Edition End User Help."}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'What are the roles and their responsibilities involved in using the American Express Business Card connection on Concur?'}]
[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What are the roles that can use the American Express Business Card connection?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What are the roles that can use the American Express Business Card connection?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To use the American Express Business Card connection, you must have one of the following roles: 
 - Client Admin: Configures the card program feature. A Concur Admin will enable the feature and set the default payment type for American Express Business Cards.
- Card Admin: Manages (hides) transactions.
- Cardholder: Registers cards and assigns transactions to reports. 
Note: To use the American Express Business Card integration, cardholders must be registered on the American Express MYCA website.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What are the roles that can use the American Express Business Card connection?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To use the American Express Business Card connection, you must have one of the following roles: 
 - Client Admin: Configures the card program feature. A Concur Admin will enable the feature and set the default payment type for American Express Business Cards.
- Card Admin: Manages (hides) transactions.
- Cardholder: Registers cards and assigns transactions to reports. 
Note: To use the American Express Business Card integration, cardholders must be registered on the American Express MYCA website.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'How can I register an American Express Business Card in the Concur system?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What are the roles that can use the American Express Business Card connection?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To use the American Express Business Card connection, you must have one of the following roles: 
 - Client Admin: Configures the card program feature. A Concur Admin will enable the feature and set the default payment type for American Express Business Cards.
- Card Admin: Manages (hides) transactions.
- Cardholder: Registers cards and assigns transactions to reports. 
Note: To use the American Express Business Card integration, cardholders must be registered on the American Express MYCA website.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'How can I register an American Express Business Card in the Concur system?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To register an American Express Business Card in the Concur system, follow these steps:

1. Ensure that the American Express Business Card connection is configured and enabled.
2. Each cardholder (primary or supplemental) must register their card individually. Primary cardholders cannot register supplemental cards on behalf of other employees.
3. If you do not have an American Express user login, create an account on the American Express MYCA website.

Here is a step-by-step guide:

1. Select the Profile icon, and then select Profile Settings.
2. In the Expense Settings section, select Expense Credit Cards.
3. Select Add Amex Business Card.
4. In the "You are now leaving Concur" box, select Continue.
5. Read the Card Data Access User Agreement, check the 'I Accept the Terms and Conditions' box, and select Continue. The user agreement only appears the first time you register.
6. On the American Express login page, enter your login credentials, and select Log In.
7. Read the information on the Authorize access to Concur disclaimer, then select Continue.
8. On the American Express authorization page, check the box for each card you want to synchronize.
9. Select Authorize to synchronize cards.
10. Select Return to Concur.
11. In the message to confirm card registration, select OK.

The registered business card will now appear on the Expense Credit Cards page in Profile settings. Concur Expense will import transactions from the last 90 days and new transactions will automatically synchronize daily. To view your transactions, select Available Expenses on the home page and add them to your expense reports. For more information, refer to the Register a Card topic in Concur Expense Standard Edition End User Help.'}]

For more information, refer to the Register a Card topic in Concur Expense Standard Edition End User Help.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "What should I do if my transactions don't appear after registering my American Express Business Card?"}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'If your transactions do not appear after registering your American Express Business Card in the Concur system, you can follow these troubleshooting steps:

1. **Verify Registration Completion:** Ensure that you have completed the registration process correctly. Double-check the steps to ensure that you have not missed any part.
   - Go to Profile Settings -> Expense Credit Cards -> Ensure your card is listed under registered cards.

2. **Synchronization Delay:** Transactions might take some time to synchronize. Normally, transactions from the past 90 days import after registration, and new transactions synchronize daily. Wait for at least 24 hours before troubleshooting further.

3. **Check MYCA Registration:** Ensure that your American Express Business Card is correctly registered on the American Express MYCA website as transactions are pulled from there.

4. **Internet Connectivity:** Ensure you have a stable internet connection during the registration process for proper synchronization.

5. **Contact Your Admin:** If you are an employee, your organization’s Concur admin or Card admin might need to check if the American Express Business Card connection is correctly configured and enabled.

6. **American Express Account Issues:** Verify that there are no issues with your American Express account by logging into the American Express MYCA website.

7. **Support:** If you have gone through the above checks and the transactions still do not appear, contact SAP Concur support or your internal technical support team for assistance.

Following these steps should help resolve transaction import issues with your American Express Business Card.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What transaction types are not supported by the American Express Business Card connection?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'The American Express Business Card connection does not support cash advances, bank charges, and addendum data transactions at this time.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'How can I view and manage the transactions that have been imported from my American Express Business Card in Concur?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What transaction types are not supported by the American Express Business Card connection?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'The American Express Business Card connection does not support cash advances, bank charges, and addendum data transactions at this time.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'How can I view and manage the transactions that have been imported from my American Express Business Card in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To view and manage the transactions imported from your American Express Business Card in Concur, follow these steps:

1. Register your American Express Business Card by navigating to Profile Settings and selecting Expense Credit Cards. From there, select Add Amex Business Card and follow the prompts to authorize and synchronize your card.

2. Once registered, transactions that occurred within the last 90 days will be imported and new transactions will synchronize daily.

3. To view your transactions, select Available Expenses on the home page. If you're using SAP Concur Expense Assistant, transactions will be automatically assigned to an expense report.

4. You can view all imported transactions on the Manage Expenses page. Transactions are also visible to delegate and proxy users.

Please note, only regular expenses and payments are supported at this time. Cash advances, bank charges, and addendum data transactions are not supported."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'Is the American Express Business Card connection feature applicable to personal or corporate cards?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'The new American Express Business Card connection feature is only applicable to American Express Business cards. [{'role': 'user', 'content': 'Is the American Express Business Card connection feature applicable to personal or corporate cards?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'The new American Express Business Card connection feature is only applicable to American Express Business cards. It does not apply to any existing or future American Express personal or corporate card programs.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'What steps should I follow to register an American Express Business Card in SAP Concur?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'Is the American Express Business Card connection feature applicable to personal or corporate cards?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'The new American Express Business Card connection feature is only applicable to American Express Business cards. It does not apply to any existing or future American Express personal or corporate card programs.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'What steps should I follow to register an American Express Business Card in SAP Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To register an American Express Business Card in SAP Concur, follow these steps:

1. Select the Profile icon and then select 'Profile Settings'.
2. In the Expense Settings section, select 'Expense Credit Cards'. The Expense Credit Cards page displays.
3. Select 'Add Amex Business Card'.
4. In the 'You are now leaving Concur' box, select 'Continue'.
5. On the 'Card Data Access User Agreement', read the agreement and select the 'I Accept the Terms and Conditions' checkbox, then select 'Continue'. (The user agreement only appears the first time you register.)
6. On the American Express login page, type your login credentials, then select 'Log In'.
7. On the 'Authorize Access to Concur' disclaimer, read the information and then select 'Continue'.
8. On the American Express authorization page, select the checkbox for each card you want to synchronize. (You can see all business cards you have registered with American Express. Supplemental cards will also be displayed only if the corresponding basic card is not displayed here. Only basic cards are shown if both are owned.)
9. Select 'Authorize' to synchronize cards.
10. Select 'Return to Concur'.
11. In the message to confirm card registration, select 'OK'.
12. The registered business card now appears on the Expense Credit Cards page in Profile settings. After the initial card registration, Concur Expense will directly import transactions that occurred within the last 90 days, and any new transactions will automatically synchronize on a daily basis.
13. Select 'Available Expenses' on the home page to view your transactions and add them to your expense reports."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'Is the American Express Business Card connection feature applicable to personal or corporate cards?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'The new American Express Business Card connection feature is only applicable to American Express Business cards. It does not apply to any existing or future American Express personal or corporate card programs.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'What steps should I follow to register an American Express Business Card in SAP Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To register an American Express Business Card in SAP Concur, follow these steps:

1. Select the Profile icon and then select 'Profile Settings'.
2. In the Expense Settings section, select 'Expense Credit Cards'. The Expense Credit Cards page displays.
3. Select 'Add Amex Business Card'.
4. In the 'You are now leaving Concur' box, select 'Continue'.
5. On the 'Card Data Access User Agreement', read the agreement and select the 'I Accept the Terms and Conditions' checkbox, then select 'Continue'. (The user agreement only appears the first time you register.)
6. On the American Express login page, type your login credentials, then select 'Log In'.
7. On the 'Authorize Access to Concur' disclaimer, read the information and then select 'Continue'.
8. On the American Express authorization page, select the checkbox for each card you want to synchronize. (You can see all business cards you have registered with American Express. Supplemental cards will also be displayed only if the corresponding basic card is not displayed here. Only basic cards are shown if both are owned.)
9. Select 'Authorize' to synchronize cards.
10. Select 'Return to Concur'.
11. In the message to confirm card registration, select 'OK'.
12. The registered business card now appears on the Expense Credit Cards page in Profile settings. After the initial card registration, Concur Expense will directly import transactions that occurred within the last 90 days, and any new transactions will automatically synchronize on a daily basis.
13. Select 'Available Expenses' on the home page to view your transactions and add them to your expense reports."}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'What role do I need to have in order to configure the American Express Business Card feature in Concur?'}]
[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What functionality does the American Express Business Card connection provide to SAP Concur users?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What functionality does the American Express Business Card connection provide to SAP Concur users?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'The American Express® Business Card connection for SAP Concur users provides the following functionalities: an automatic daily refresh of transactions from American Express into Concur Expense, eliminating the need for users to log into the American Express Manage Your Card Account (MYCA) website to refresh transactions; compatibility with SAP Concur Expense Assistant; the ability for the primary cardholder to manage their transactions without viewing all supplemental card transactions; support for delegate and proxy capabilities on transactions; handling of foreign transaction currencies; visibility of available transactions; inclusion of Concur Analytics for Standard reporting (including unsubmitted transactions); and admin-only deletion of transactions, providing full visibility and compliance assurances. This feature is exclusively for American Express® Business cards and requires cardholders to be registered on the American Express® MYCA website.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What functionality does the American Express Business Card connection provide to SAP Concur users?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'The American Express® Business Card connection for SAP Concur users provides the following functionalities: an automatic daily refresh of transactions from American Express into Concur Expense, eliminating the need for users to log into the American Express Manage Your Card Account (MYCA) website to refresh transactions; compatibility with SAP Concur Expense Assistant; the ability for the primary cardholder to manage their transactions without viewing all supplemental card transactions; support for delegate and proxy capabilities on transactions; handling of foreign transaction currencies; visibility of available transactions; inclusion of Concur Analytics for Standard reporting (including unsubmitted transactions); and admin-only deletion of transactions, providing full visibility and compliance assurances. This feature is exclusively for American Express® Business cards and requires cardholders to be registered on the American Express® MYCA website.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I re-add a deleted card for the American Express Business Card connection in Concur?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What functionality does the American Express Business Card connection provide to SAP Concur users?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'The American Express® Business Card connection for SAP Concur users provides the following functionalities: an automatic daily refresh of transactions from American Express into Concur Expense, eliminating the need for users to log into the American Express Manage Your Card Account (MYCA) website to refresh transactions; compatibility with SAP Concur Expense Assistant; the ability for the primary cardholder to manage their transactions without viewing all supplemental card transactions; support for delegate and proxy capabilities on transactions; handling of foreign transaction currencies; visibility of available transactions; inclusion of Concur Analytics for Standard reporting (including unsubmitted transactions); and admin-only deletion of transactions, providing full visibility and compliance assurances. This feature is exclusively for American Express® Business cards and requires cardholders to be registered on the American Express® MYCA website.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I re-add a deleted card for the American Express Business Card connection in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To re-add a deleted American Express Business Card in Concur, follow these steps: 
1. Select the Profile icon, and then select 'Profile Settings'.
2. In the 'Expense Settings' section, select 'Expense Credit Cards'.
3. Select 'Add Amex Business Card'.
4. In the 'You are now leaving Concur' box, select 'Continue'.
5. On the 'Card Data Access User Agreement' page, read the agreement, select the 'I Accept the Terms and Conditions' check box, then select 'Continue'.
6. On the 'American Express' login page, enter your login credentials, then select 'Log In'.
7. On the 'Authorize access to Concur' page, read the information and then select 'Continue'.
8. On the 'American Express authorization' page, select the check box for each card you want to synchronize.
9. Select 'Authorize' to synchronize the cards.
10. Select 'Return to Concur'.
11. In the message to confirm card registration, select 'OK'.
The re-added card will now appear on the 'Expense Credit Cards' page in Profile settings, and any new transactions will automatically synchronize daily."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What functionality does the American Express Business Card connection provide to SAP Concur users?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'The American Express® Business Card connection for SAP Concur users provides the following functionalities: an automatic daily refresh of transactions from American Express into Concur Expense, eliminating the need for users to log into the American Express Manage Your Card Account (MYCA) website to refresh transactions; compatibility with SAP Concur Expense Assistant; the ability for the primary cardholder to manage their transactions without viewing all supplemental card transactions; support for delegate and proxy capabilities on transactions; handling of foreign transaction currencies; visibility of available transactions; inclusion of Concur Analytics for Standard reporting (including unsubmitted transactions); and admin-only deletion of transactions, providing full visibility and compliance assurances. The re-added card will now appear on the 'Expense Credit Cards' page in Profile settings, and any new transactions will automatically synchronize daily."}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'How can I manage and view my American Express Business Card transactions in Concur after they are synchronized?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "After American Express Business Card transactions are synchronized with SAP Concur, you can manage and view them as follows: 1. **View Transactions:** - Go to the 'Manage Expenses' page where you will see all your American Express Business Card transactions. - These transactions are also visible to delegate and proxy users who have access to manage your expenses. 2. **Automatic Assignment to Expense Reports:** - If you are using SAP Concur Expense Assistant, the transactions will be automatically assigned to an expense report. - Any new transactions will synchronize daily to ensure that your records are up-to-date. 3. **Expense Report Creation:** - You can select 'Available Expenses' on the home page to view your new transactions and add them to your expense reports manually. 4. **Handling Foreign Transactions:** - The system provides transaction currency handling for foreign transactions, ensuring that they are correctly processed and displayed. 5. **Administration:** - Transactions can only be deleted by admins, which helps maintain full visibility into usage and provides additional compliance assurances. If you delete a card and need to re-add it, follow the provided instructions to register your card again. For detailed steps, refer to the 'Registering an American Express Business Card' section in the Concur Expense Standard Edition End User Help."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How can users add their American Express Business Cards in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To add their American Express Business Cards in Concur, users should follow these steps:

1. Select the Profile icon, and then select Profile Settings.
2. In the Expense Settings section, select Expense Credit Cards. The Expense Credit Cards page will display.
3. Select Add Amex Business Card.
4. In the 'You are now leaving Concur' box, select Continue.
5. On the Card Data Access User Agreement, read the agreement and select the 'I Accept the Terms and Conditions' checkbox, then select Continue. The user agreement appears only the first time you register.
6. On the American Express login page, type your login credentials, then select Log In.
7. On the 'Authorize access to Concur' disclaimer, read the information and then select Continue.
8. On the American Express authorization page, select the checkbox for each card you want to synchronize.
9. Select Authorize to synchronize cards.
10. Select Return to Concur.
11. In the message to confirm card registration, select OK.

The registered business card will now appear on the Expense Credit Cards page in Profile settings. Initial card registration will import transactions from the last 90 days, and new transactions will synchronize daily."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'Who can delete transactions in the American Express Business Card connection in Concur Expense?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'Transactions in the American Express Business Card connection in Concur Expense can only be deleted by admins.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I register my American Express Business Card in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To register your American Express Business Card in Concur Expense, follow these steps:

4. In the 'You are now leaving Concur' box, select Continue.
5. On the Card Data Access User Agreement page, read the agreement, check the 'I Accept the Terms and Conditions' box, and then select Continue. You will only need to do this the first time you register.
6. On the American Express login page, enter your login credentials, and then select Log In.
7. On the Authorize access to Concur disclaimer, read the information and then select Continue.
8. On the American Express authorization page, check the box for each card you want to synchronize.
9. Select Authorize to synchronize the cards.
10. Select Return to Concur.
11. In the confirmation message for card registration, select OK.

Your registered business card will now appear on the Expense Credit Cards page in Profile settings. [{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What is Expense Pay in SAP Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'Expense Pay in SAP Concur is the Electronic Funds Transfer (EFT) feature that allows you to authorize direct deposits to your personal bank account for cash advances and reimbursement of your out-of-pocket travel and expense transactions.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What is Expense Pay in SAP Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'Expense Pay in SAP Concur is the Electronic Funds Transfer (EFT) feature that allows you to authorize direct deposits to your personal bank account for cash advances and reimbursement of your out-of-pocket travel and expense transactions.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "How do I find my bank routing number again if I don't have a check?"}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "If you don't have a check to find your bank routing number, you can access your bank information from the SAP Concur home page by clicking on the Profile icon, and then selecting Profile Settings. [{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How can I authorize direct deposits to my bank account using SAP Concur?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How can I authorize direct deposits to my bank account using SAP Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To authorize direct deposits to your bank account using SAP Concur, follow these steps:

1. From the SAP Concur home page, click the Profile icon, and then click Profile Settings.
2. On the Profile Options page, in the Expense Settings section, select Bank Information.
3. On the Bank Information page, complete the required and optional fields as defined by your company. Required fields are indicated with a red bar. If needed, scroll down to view a sample check to help you locate your routing and bank account numbers, which can be found at the bottom of your personal checks.
4. Once you have entered your bank account information in the form, select Save and Authorize, and then select OK.
5. After your bank record is saved, check your bank account for the penny deposit amounts that were sent to your account, and then verify them on the Bank Information page.

Once the amounts are verified, the Status will display 'Confirmed', and you will start receiving your direct deposit funds."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How can I authorize direct deposits to my bank account using SAP Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To authorize direct deposits to your bank account using SAP Concur, follow these steps:

1. From the SAP Concur home page, click the Profile icon, and then click Profile Settings.
2. On the Profile Options page, in the Expense Settings section, select Bank Information.
3. On the Bank Information page, complete the required and optional fields as defined by your company. Required fields are indicated with a red bar. If needed, scroll down to view a sample check to help you locate your routing and bank account numbers, which can be found at the bottom of your personal checks.
4. Once you have entered your bank account information in the form, select Save and Authorize, and then select OK.
5. After your bank record is saved, check your bank account for the penny deposit amounts that were sent to your account, and then verify them on the Bank Information page.

Once the amounts are verified, the Status will display 'Confirmed', and you will start receiving your direct deposit funds."}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'How long does it take for the penny deposits to show up in my bank account?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'Where can I find my Bank Routing Number and Bank Account Number on my personal checks?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'Your Bank Routing Number and Bank Account Number can be found at the bottom of your personal checks.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'Can you explain how I can enter my bank account information for activating direct deposit in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To enter your bank account information for activating direct deposit in Concur, follow these steps:

1. From the SAP Concur home page, click the Profile icon, and then click Profile Settings.
2. On the Profile Options page, navigate to the Expense Settings section and select Bank Information.
3. On the Bank Information page, complete the required and optional fields as defined by your company. Required fields are indicated with a red bar.
4. If you need help locating your routing and bank account numbers, scroll down to view a sample check.
5. Scroll back up and enter your bank account information in the form. Once you have completed the necessary fields, select Save and Authorize, and then click OK.
6. After your employee bank record is saved, check your bank account for the penny deposit amounts sent to your account, then verify those amounts on the Bank Information page. Once verified, the Status will display Confirmed, and you will start receiving your direct deposit funds.

Your Bank Routing Number and Bank Account Number can be found at the bottom of your personal checks.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What should I do after finding my bank routing and account numbers?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'Once you have found your bank routing and account numbers, you should activate direct deposit for your cash advances and reimbursement of out-of-pocket travel and expense transactions. First, access your banking information by logging into the SAP Concur home page, clicking on the Profile icon, and then selecting Profile Settings. In the Expense Settings section, click on Bank Information to find the page where you can enter your details. Complete all the required fields, which are marked with a red bar. If needed, you can refer to a sample check to locate your routing and account numbers. Once you have entered your bank account information, click Save and Authorize, and then confirm by selecting OK. After your employee bank record is saved, check your bank account for small deposit amounts sent to verify your account. Enter these amounts on the Bank Information page, and once confirmed, the status will display Confirmed, ensuring that you will start receiving direct deposit funds.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I save and authorize my bank account information in SAP Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To save and authorize your bank account information in SAP Concur for direct deposits, follow these steps: 1. From the SAP Concur home page, click on the Profile icon and then select Profile Settings. 2. In the Profile Options page, navigate to the Expense Settings section and select Bank Information. 3. On the Bank Information page, fill out the required and optional fields as defined by your company. Required fields are indicated with a red bar. 4. If you need help locating your routing and bank account numbers, you can scroll down to view a sample check. Your Bank Routing Number and Bank Account Number can be found at the bottom of your personal checks. 5. Enter your bank account information in the form. Once all necessary fields are completed, select Save and Authorize, then click OK. 6. After saving your bank record, check your bank account for the penny deposit amounts sent by SAP Concur. Verify these amounts on the Bank Information page. Once the deposit amounts are verified, the status will display as Confirmed, and you will start receiving your direct deposit funds.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'When will I start receiving my direct deposit funds in SAP Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'Once the penny deposit amounts sent to your bank account are verified and the Status displays Confirmed, you will start receiving your direct deposit funds in SAP Concur.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I access the Bank Information page in SAP Concur to set up my direct deposit?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To access the Bank Information page in SAP Concur to set up your direct deposit, follow these steps:

1. From the SAP Concur home page, click the Profile icon, and then click Profile Settings.
2. On the Profile Options page, in the Expense Settings section, select Bank Information.
3. On the Bank Information page, complete the required and optional fields as defined by your company. Required fields are indicated with a red bar.
4. Scroll down to view a sample check if you need help locating your routing and bank account numbers. These numbers can be found at the bottom of your personal checks.
5. Scroll back up and enter your bank account information in the form. When you have completed the necessary fields, select Save and Authorize, and then select OK.
6. After your employee bank record is saved, check your bank account for the penny deposit amounts that were sent to your bank account, and then verify them on the Bank Information page.

Once the amounts are verified, the Status will display Confirmed, and you will start receiving your direct deposit funds.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'Where in SAP Concur can I check if my bank account information has been confirmed?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'Where in SAP Concur can I check if my bank account information has been confirmed?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To check if your bank account information has been confirmed in SAP Concur, follow these steps:

1. From the SAP Concur home page, click the Profile icon and then click Profile Settings.
2. On the Profile Options page, in the Expense Settings section, select Bank Information.
3. After your bank record is saved, check your bank account for the penny deposit amounts that were sent. Verify these amounts on the Bank Information page.
4. Once the amounts are verified, the Status displays 'Confirmed', indicating that your bank account information has been confirmed."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I add a delegate to my Concur profile?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I add a delegate to my Concur profile?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To add a delegate to your Concur profile, follow these steps:

1. Select the Profile icon, and then select Profile Settings.
2. On the Profile Options page, select Expense Delegates.
3. From the Delegates tab, select Add to add a new delegate.
4. Search for and select a delegate by employee name, email address, or login ID, and then select Add.
5. Assign permissions to the new delegate using the appropriate checkboxes. To allow a delegate to email receipts, ensure you select the Can View Receipts checkbox.
6. After assigning permissions, select Save.

To allow a delegate to email receipts, both you and the delegate must verify your email addresses in your respective Profile Settings and email accounts. To do this:

1. Select the Profile icon, and then select Profile Settings.
2. Select Email Addresses under the Email Addresses section.
3. Select Travel Arrangers/Delegates.
4. Verify your email address by selecting Verify, then selecting OK in the Verification Email Sent popup window.
5. Enter the code sent by SAP Concur in the Enter Code field, and then select OK.

Once both you and your delegate have verified your email addresses, the delegate can email receipts to receipts@concur.com with your verified email address in the subject line. These emailed images will appear in your Available Receipts library as if you had done it yourself.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I add a delegate to my Concur profile?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To add a delegate to your Concur profile, follow these steps:

1. Select the Profile icon, and then select Profile Settings.
2. On the Profile Options page, select Expense Delegates.
3. From the Delegates tab, select Add to add a new delegate.
4. Search for and select a delegate by employee name, email address, or login ID, and then select Add.
5. Assign permissions to the new delegate using the appropriate checkboxes. To allow a delegate to email receipts, ensure you select the Can View Receipts checkbox.
6. After assigning permissions, select Save.

To allow a delegate to email receipts, both you and the delegate must verify your email addresses in your respective Profile Settings and email accounts. To do this:

1. Select the Profile icon, and then select Profile Settings.
2. Select Email Addresses under the Email Addresses section.
3. Select Travel Arrangers/Delegates.
4. Verify your email address by selecting Verify, then selecting OK in the Verification Email Sent popup window.
5. Enter the code sent by SAP Concur in the Enter Code field, and then select OK.

Once both you and your delegate have verified your email addresses, the delegate can email receipts to receipts@concur.com with your verified email address in the subject line. These emailed images will appear in your Available Receipts library as if you had done it yourself.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'Can you explain how to verify my email address in Concur?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What are the steps to add an Expense delegate in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To add an Expense delegate in Concur, follow these steps: 1. Select the Profile icon, and then select Profile Settings. 2. On the Profile Options page, select Expense Delegates. 3. From the Delegates tab, select Add. 4. Search for and select a delegate by employee name, email address, or login ID, and then select Add. 5. Assign permissions to the new delegate using the appropriate check box(es). To allow a delegate to email receipts into your Available Receipts library, select the Can View Receipts check box. 6. When done assigning all delegate permissions, select Save. 7. Both you and the delegate must verify your email addresses in your respective Profile Settings and email accounts to allow the delegate to email receipts. 8. To verify an email address, select the Profile icon, then Profile Settings. 9. Select Email Addresses in the Profile Settings. 10. In the Email Addresses section, select Travel Arrangers/Delegates. 11. To verify your email address, select Verify, then select OK in the Verification Email Sent pop-up window. 12. Enter the verification code sent by SAP Concur in the Enter Code field and select OK. Once both you and your delegate have successfully verified your email addresses, the delegate can email receipts to receipts@concur.com with the verified email address in the subject line. The emailed images will appear in your Available Receipts library.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What are the steps to add an Expense delegate in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To add an Expense delegate in Concur, follow these steps: 1. Select the Profile icon, and then select Profile Settings. 2. On the Profile Options page, select Expense Delegates. 3. From the Delegates tab, select Add. 4. Search for and select a delegate by employee name, email address, or login ID, and then select Add. 5. Assign permissions to the new delegate using the appropriate check box(es). To allow a delegate to email receipts into your Available Receipts library, select the Can View Receipts check box. 6. When done assigning all delegate permissions, select Save. 7. Both you and the delegate must verify your email addresses in your respective Profile Settings and email accounts to allow the delegate to email receipts. 8. To verify an email address, select the Profile icon, then Profile Settings. 9. Select Email Addresses in the Profile Settings. 10. In the Email Addresses section, select Travel Arrangers/Delegates. 11. To verify your email address, select Verify, then select OK in the Verification Email Sent pop-up window. 12. Enter the verification code sent by SAP Concur in the Enter Code field and select OK. Once both you and your delegate have successfully verified your email addresses, the delegate can email receipts to receipts@concur.com with the verified email address in the subject line. The emailed images will appear in your Available Receipts library.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'How can I remove an Expense delegate from my Concur profile?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I get to the Expense Delegates page?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To get to the Expense Delegates page, select the Profile icon, then select Profile Settings. On the Profile Options page, select Expense Delegates.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I add a delegate after reaching the Expense Delegates page?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To add a delegate after reaching the Expense Delegates page, follow these steps:

1. From the Delegates tab, select Add.
2. Search for and select a delegate by employee name, email address, or login ID, and then select Add.
3. Assign permissions to the new delegate using the appropriate check box(es). Note: To allow a delegate to email receipts into a user’s Available Receipts library, you must select the Can View Receipts check box.
4. When you are done assigning all the delegate permissions, select Save.

To allow a delegate to email receipts, both you and the delegate must verify your email addresses in your respective Profile Settings and email accounts. Here’s how:

1. Select the Profile icon, and then select Profile Settings.
2. Select Email Addresses in the Profile Settings section.
3. In the Email Addresses section, select Travel Arrangers/Delegates.
4. To verify your email address, select Verify, and then in the Verification Email Sent pop-up window, select OK.
5. For verification purposes, type the code (sent by SAP Concur) in the Enter Code field, and then select OK.'}]

1. From the Delegates tab, select Add.
2. Search for and select a delegate by employee name, email address, or login ID, and then select Add.
3. Assign permissions to the new delegate using the appropriate check box(es). Note: To allow a delegate to email receipts into a user’s Available Receipts library, you must select the Can View Receipts check box.

To allow a delegate to email receipts, both you and the delegate must verify your email addresses in your respective Profile Settings and email accounts. Here’s how:

1. Select the Profile icon, and then select Profile Settings.
2. Select Email Addresses in the Profile Settings section.
3. In the Email Addresses section, select Travel Arrangers/Delegates.
4. To verify your email address, select Verify, and then in the Verification Email Sent pop-up window, select OK.
5. For verification purposes, type the code (sent by SAP Concur) in the Enter Code field, and then select OK.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "What if my delegate can't find the verification email?"}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "If your delegate can't find the verification email, here are a few steps you can suggest:

1. **Check Spam/Junk Folder**: Ask the delegate to check their spam or junk email folder in case the verification email was filtered there.

2. **Resend Verification Email**: Both you and the delegate can log in to your respective profiles, go to Profile Settings, and select Email Addresses. From there, you can select Travel Arrangers/Delegates and click Verify to resend the verification email.

3. **Whitelist SAP Concur Email**: Ensure that the SAP Concur email address (usually something like notifications@concur.com) is added to the safe sender list or contact list to prevent the email from being marked as spam.

4. **Contact Support**: If the delegate still can't find the verification email after trying the above steps, contact your IT department or SAP Concur customer support for further assistance."}]

For verification purposes, type the code (sent by SAP Concur) in the Enter Code field, and then select OK.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "What if my delegate can't find the verification email?"}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "If your delegate can't find the verification email, here are a few steps you can suggest:

1. **Check Spam/Junk Folder**: Ask the delegate to check their spam or junk email folder in case the verification email was filtered there.

2. **Resend Verification Email**: Both you and the delegate can log in to your respective profiles, go to Profile Settings, and select Email Addresses. From there, you can select Travel Arrangers/Delegates and click Verify to resend the verification email.

3. **Whitelist SAP Concur Email**: Ensure that the SAP Concur email address (usually something like notifications@concur.com) is added to the safe sender list or contact list to prevent the email from being marked as spam.

4. **Contact Support**: If the delegate still can't find the verification email after trying the above steps, contact your IT department or SAP Concur customer support for further assistance."}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'Are there any specific settings that need to be configured for my delegate to be able to submit and approve expense reports on my behalf?'}]
[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What is required to add a new delegate in Concur?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What is required to add a new delegate in Concur?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To add a new delegate in Concur, follow these steps:

1. Select the Profile icon and then select Profile Settings.
2. On the Profile Options page, select Expense Delegates.
3. From the Delegates tab, select Add.
4. Search for and select a delegate by employee name, email address, or login id, and then select Add.
5. Assign permissions to the new delegate using the appropriate check boxes. To allow a delegate to email receipts into a user’s Available Receipts library, you must select the Can View Receipts check box.
6. When done assigning all the delegate permissions, select Save.
7. Both you and the delegate must verify your email addresses in your respective Profile Settings and email accounts to enable receipt submission via email to receipts@concur.com.
8. To verify an email address, select the Profile icon and then select Profile Settings.
9. Begin the email verification process by selecting Email Addresses.
10. In the Email Addresses section, select Travel Arrangers/Delegates.
11. To verify your email address, select Verify, and then in the Verification Email Sent popup window, select OK.
12. For verification purposes, type the code sent by SAP Concur in the Enter Code field, and then select OK. You can copy and paste the code into the Enter Code field.

After both you and your delegate have successfully verified your email addresses, the delegate can email receipts on your behalf to receipts@concur.com with the user's verified email address in the Subject line. Emailed images will display in the Available Receipts library of your profile."}]

6. When done assigning all the delegate permissions, select Save.

8. To verify an email address, select the Profile icon and then select Profile Settings.

10. In the Email Addresses section, select Travel Arrangers/Delegates.
11. To verify your email address, select Verify, and then in the Verification Email Sent popup window, select OK.
12. For verification purposes, type the code sent by SAP Concur in the Enter Code field, and then select OK. You can copy and paste the code into the Enter Code field.

After both you and your delegate have successfully verified your email addresses, the delegate can email receipts on your behalf to receipts@concur.com with the user's verified email address in the Subject line. Emailed images will display in the Available Receipts library of your profile."}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'What actions can my delegate perform on my behalf once they are added?'}]

Search for and select a delegate by employee name, email address, or login id and then select Add.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I assign permissions to a new delegate after adding them?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To assign permissions to a new delegate after adding them, follow these steps: 1. After searching for and selecting a delegate by employee name, email address, or login id, select 'Add.' 2. Assign permissions to the new delegate using the appropriate checkboxes. For example, to allow a delegate to email receipts into a user’s Available Receipts library, select the 'Can View Receipts' checkbox. 3. When you are done assigning all the delegate permissions, select 'Save.' 4. To enable the delegate to email receipts, both you and the delegate must verify your email addresses in your respective Profile Settings and email accounts. 5. To verify an email address, select the Profile icon, then select Profile Settings. 6. Select 'Email Addresses' and then 'Travel Arrangers/Delegates.' 7. To verify your email address, select 'Verify,' and then in the Verification Email Sent pop-up window, select 'OK.' 8. Type the code sent by SAP Concur in the 'Enter Code' field and select 'OK.' After both you and your delegate have successfully verified your email addresses, the delegate can email receipts on your behalf for use in expense reporting by sending an email to receipts@concur.com with the attached receipt images. Ensure the user’s verified email address is in the subject line. Emailed images will display in the Available Receipts library of your profile."}, {'role': 'user', 'content': 'So, how can I check if my delegate has verified their email?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To check if your delegate has verified their email, follow these steps: 1. Select the Profile icon, then choose Profile Settings. 2. On the Profile Options page, select Expense Delegates. 3. From the Delegates tab, find the delegate you wish to check. 4. If the delegate's email is verified, it will indicate this status next to their email address in your profile settings. If it is not verified, you may need to remind your delegate to complete the email verification process as previously outlined."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What permissions can I assign to a Concur delegate?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What permissions can I assign to a Concur delegate?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To assign permissions to a Concur delegate, follow these steps: 1. Go to the Profile icon and select Profile Settings. 2. On the Profile Options page, select Expense Delegates. 3. From the Delegates tab, select Add, then search for and select a delegate by employee name, email address, or login id, and add them. 4. Assign the necessary permissions using the appropriate check boxes. Note: To allow a delegate to email receipts to your Available Receipts library, you must check the 'Can View Receipts' box. 5. Select Save after you finish assigning permissions. Note that both you and the delegate must verify your email addresses to enable receipt submission via email to receipts@concur.com."}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What permissions can I assign to a Concur delegate?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': "To assign permissions to a Concur delegate, follow these steps: 1. [{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I allow a delegate to email receipts into my Available Receipts library?'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I allow a delegate to email receipts into my Available Receipts library?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To allow a delegate to email receipts into your Available Receipts library, follow these steps: 1. Select the Profile icon, then Profile Settings. 2. On the Profile Options page, select Expense Delegates. 3. Go to the Delegates tab and select Add. 4. Search for and select a delegate by employee name, email address, or login ID, then select Add. 5. Assign permissions to the new delegate by selecting the Can View Receipts check box. 6. Select Save. Both you and the delegate must verify your email addresses in your respective Profile Settings and email accounts. To verify an email address, select the Profile icon, then Profile Settings, followed by Email Addresses. In the Email Addresses section, select Travel Arrangers/Delegates. Select Verify, then follow the instructions in the Verification Email Sent popup window to complete the process. Once both email addresses are verified, the delegate can email receipts to receipts@concur.com with the user’s verified email address in the Subject line. The emailed images will display in the Available Receipts library of your profile.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'How do I allow a delegate to email receipts into my Available Receipts library?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'To allow a delegate to email receipts into your Available Receipts library, follow these steps: 1. [{'role': 'user', 'content': 'Why do both I and my delegate need to verify our email addresses?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'Both you and your delegate need to verify your email addresses to enable the feature that allows a delegate to email receipts on your behalf. This verification process ensures that the receipts sent via email are properly associated with your expense reports. By confirming your email addresses in your respective Profile Settings and email accounts, the system can authenticate and securely process receipt submissions sent to receipts@concur.com.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'Why do both I and my delegate need to verify our email addresses?'}, {'role': 'system', 'content': 'Both you and your delegate need to verify your email addresses to enable the feature that allows a delegate to email receipts on your behalf.
